title: Vrat-Special Makhana Khichdi Recipe
method: 1. Soak makhanas in water for at least 15 minutes. Boil the potatoes and cut them into small cubes.
2. Heat ghee in a pan. Roast cumin seeds. When they start to crackle, add green chillies and peanuts, and roast them.
3. Add potatoes and roast them. Add makhanas, salt, red chilli powder and mango powder.
4. Mix well and cook for 5-6 minutes. Serve hot.

title: Satpura Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half Cup All Purpose Flour

method: 1. Start by kneading the dough. For this, take a mixing bowl, add all-purpose flour, oil, butter and ajwain. Mix everything well and knead a soft dough. Once done, cover it with wet muslin cloth and set aside.

2. Now take a small portion from the dough and start rolling it with the help of a rolling pin. Keep rolling until the portion gets very thin. Roll the dough into a rectangle 12"x 26". Once done, spread butter all over the portion. Dust it with all-purpose flour.
3. Place butter in center and fold first one end over, then the other. Spread butter and dust maida. Then again fold from both the corners, Keep folding until 7 times.
4. Refrigerate for an hour or more.
1. Now add cumin seeds and wait until splutters.
2. Add chopped ginger and green chillies now.
3. Now add boiled mashed potatoes, add all the spices along with salt to taste.
4. Mix everything well and saute for 5-6 minutes.
1. Take the dough out from fridge and dust it with some flour.
2. Roll it out into rectangular way.
3. Now cut the dough into four equal pieces.
4. Wet edges, place the mixture in one half and fold over. Press to seal.
5. Deep fry all the satpuras and enjoy with chole and chutney.

title: Chhattisgarh's Batkar Curry Recipe
method: 1. Wash and soak the dal overnight.
2. Next day, pressure-cook the dal with some salt. Keep aside.
3. Take curd, besan, haldi, cumin and coriander powder and salt in a bowl. Add water and mix. Keep aside.
4. Heat oil in kadhai and add red chilli and mustard seeds to it. Let it splutter.
5. Add onion and curry leaves and fry until the onion turns translucent in colour.
6. Add the boiled dal and mix for some time.
7. Finally add the buttermilk and simmer for 5 minutes.
8. Sprinkle freshly chopped coriander leaves (optional) and serve.

title: Flax Seeds Crackers Recipe
method: 1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
2. In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients and mix until an even dough forms.
3. Spread evenly onto a parchment or silicone lined baking sheet – about 1/8-1/4 inch thick.
4. Gently cut dough into squares on the baking sheet (you just need to score the dough so it snaps after it’s baked)
5. Bake for 20-30 minutes until crisp and edges are browned but not burnt.

title: Spinach Avocado Smoothie Recipe
method: 1. Cube the apple and chop the frozen banana into chunks.
2. In your blender combine almond milk, spinach, avocado, apple, banana and chia seeds.
3. Blend until smooth. Pour into a glass and sprinkle a few chia seeds on top to garnish.

title: Paneer Pancake Recipe

ingredient.description: Whole Eggs , or Flax Meal Egg Replacer

method: 1. Beat eggs in a clean and dry bowl till light and fluffy.

2. Add sugar and beat till the sugar is combined. Stir in the smooth paneer, baking powder, plain flour and salt to the beaten egg mixture. Add the milk and whisk to combine well. You should have a thick pancake batter.
3. Heat a skillet over low heat. Melt some butter and pour in a large ladle of the paneer pancake batter onto the pan. The batter will spread on its own and settle down.
4. When you notice bubbles appear on top, flip over and cook the paneer pancake the other side.
5. Once done, proceed the same way with the remaining batter and transfer the paneer pancakes to a serving plate.
6. Serve the Paneer Pancake topped with fruits and honey or maple syrup as a wholesome high protein breakfast.

title: Avocado Mash On Toast Recipe
method: 1. Lightly toast the slices of bread and keep aside to cool down.
2. Peel the avocado and scoop out the flesh in a bowl.
3. Add spring onions, lime juice, coriander, green chilli, olive oil and black salt. Mix well.
4. Spread it evenly on the toasted bread and enjoy.

title: Clear Mushroom Soup Recipe

ingredient.description: tsp Crushed black pepper or pepper powder
tsp or as required Gluten free naturally fermented soy sauce or regular soy sauce

method: 1. Rinse, wipe and slice 200 grams white button mushrooms. Rinse and slice 2 small spring onions. Finely chop 2 to 3 small to medium garlic cloves, 1/2 inch ginger and 1 small celery stem.
1. In a pan heat ½ tablespoon sesame oil and add the chopped garlic and ginger, saute for a few seconds.
2. Now add the sliced spring onion whites only & saute for a minute. Now add the sliced mushrooms and chopped celery. Stir and saute for two minutes on medium flame.
3. Now add 3 cups of water & stir, simmer the soup for 4 to 5 minutes on a low flame.
4. Add 1 teaspoon gluten free naturally fermented soy sauce or regular soy sauce. Adjust preference as per taste.
5. Now add ½ teaspoon crushed black pepper and salt as per taste. Keep a check on salt as soy sauce already has some salt in it.
6. Cover with a lid and simmer the soup on a low to medium flame for 15 minutes or till the mushrooms are cooked.
7. Turn off the flame. Check the taste, make additions if required.
8. Now add 5 tablespoons of spring onion greens, chopped.
9. Serve clear mushroom soup hot with toast at the side.

title: Cream Of Spinach Soup Recipe

ingredient.description: medium Potatoes (½ kg), peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
and a half cup Chicken or vegetable broth

method: 1. Take a large saucepan and place over medium heat, add butter, add the chopped onions to the pan and sauté for 4 minutes or until translucent.

2. Now add the potatoes, chicken broth, water, and bouillon cubes. Bring the mixture to a boil, now reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Add spinach and cook for 2 to 4 minutes, until spinach is tender.
3. Purée the soup mixture in a blender and return the mixture to the saucepan.
4. Over low heat whisk while adding salt, pepper and sour cream until fully incorporated.
5. Garnish with chopped chives, sprinkles of allspice, or a dollop of sour cream and serve.

title: Mango Phalsa Chaat Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl combine diced mangoes with honey, salt, mint, chaat masala, lemon juice and chilli flakes.
2. Toss gently to mix all ingredients well.
3. Transfer to a serving glass and put phalsa berries all over the chaat. Garnish with mint sprig.
4. Serve and enjoy!

title: Thai Corn Fritters Recipe
method: 1. Add flour, black salt and baking powder to a medium-sized mixing bowl. Gradually pour in coconut milk while whisking to make a smooth batter and then add the oil.
2. If you need to defrost the corn, boil water in a saucepan and add the corn. Let it boil for 4-5 minutes and then drain.
3. Mix the corn into the bowl containing the batter.
4. Add chopped spring onion, red chilli, grated ginger, coriander, lime juice, soy sauce, sesame seed oil, salt, egg, all-purpose flour, baking powder. Mix everything together.
5. Now, heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add a spoonful of corn batter to the pan to make the fritters. Fry for 3 to 4 minutes on each side. Remove the fritters from the pan and serve with some ketchup.

title: Kolache Pohe (Konkani-Style Poha) Recipe
method: 1. Soak jaggery and tamarind in water separately and strain the water.
2. In a bowl of coconut milk, add the jaggery and tamarind water, salt, green chillies, coriander leaves and salt. Mix everything together.
3. Prepare a tadka. Heat ghee, add red chilli, jeera, mustard seeds, curry leaves and hing and let the spices splutter.
4. Add the tadka to the coconut milk and pour the milk on soaked poha.
5. And kolache pohe is ready to be relished.

title: Oats Appe Recipe
method: 1. Take soaked urad dal and grind it till smooth.
2. To this add powdered oats with salt, red chilli powder and pepper.
3. Mix this and add chopped onion, carrot and capsicum. Combine this well.
4. Then take the appa maker and grease it.
5. Drop spoonful of this batter in the greased pan and let it cook.
6. Then flip and cook from other side. Once brown and crisp, take it out and serve!

title: Veg Makhani (Veg Makhanwala) Recipe
method: 1. Sautee the chopped cauliflower, potatoes, beans, carrots and peas. Keep this aside.
2. Soak cashew in hot water for 30 mins. Grind the soaked cashew, chopped tomato, ginger and garlic and make a smooth paste.
3. Heat butter in a pan. Saute tej patta and the tomato-cashew paste. Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder and fry the spices. Pour the water and add the green chilli. Let it cook for a while.
4. Once it thickens and add the sauted vegetables, garam masala, sugar, salt and the cream. Combine this to the gravy and remove from flame.
5. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve the veg makhanwala hot!

title: Bread Pakora Chaat Recipe
method: 1. To make the potatoes filling, take a bowl, add boiled potatoes, green chillies, salt, red chilli powder, garam masala.
2. Mash the potatoes perfectly.
3. Now stuff two slice of bread with potato filling.
4. For batter, take a bowl, add besan, salt and water. Mix everything. Ps: make sure the batter is thick.
5. Now dip stuffed bread slices in the batter and deep fry them until golden.
6. Cut the fried bread pakora in 4 equal parts. Place in a plate and pour both chutneys along with curd.
7. Sprinkle sev, pomegranate kernels, coriander leaves and chaat masala on top it
8. Repeat the same process with the remaining bread pakoda.
9. Serve and enjoy!

title: Mango Yogurt Parfait Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half cup Hung Low fat yogurt
A few saffron strands, soaked in water

method: 1. Take hung yogurt in a bowl, add low calorie sweetner, green cardamom powder, saffron water and whisk till smooth. Transfer into a piping bag and snip the end.

2. To layer the parfait, add a portion of the muesli into individual serving glasses. Pipe out a portion of the sweetened yogurt, add a portion of the mango pieces, and add 1 tbsp soaked basil seeds into each glass.

3. Top it with a portion of muesli again, pipe some of the yogurt mixture, add some of the mango pieces and top it up with 1 tsp soaked basil seeds on to each glass. Garnish with mint sprig and serve immediately.

title: Falsa Chutney Recipe
method: 1. First of all, take false in a pan, add water to it and cook on medium flame till it becomes soft.
2. When the falsa becomes soft, take it out in a vessel and cool it. After cooling, blend them well in a mixer grinder.
3. Now filter it with the help of a sieve and take it out in the pan. Now turn on the gas and keep the pan on it and start cooking the blended falsa.
4. Add jaggery to it and let the jaggery dissolve completely. After this add red chili and salt and mix it well.
5. Lastly add vinegar and after cooking for a few seconds take it out in a serving bowl. Your sweet and sour phalsa chutney is ready.

title: Restaurant-Style Biryani Gravy Recipe
method: 1. First dry roast peanuts, almonds and sesame seeds in a pan and keep aside.
2. Now put half a tablespoon of oil in a pan and heat it, add two chopped onions and fry it lightly, along with it add two whole red chilies and chopped tomatoes and fry it.

3. If it becomes lightly pinkish in colour, then turn off the gas and take it out in a mixer jar. Along with this, add pre-roasted almonds, sesame and peanuts to it and make a smooth paste by adding a little water.
4. Now heat oil in a pan, add cumin, clove, small cardamom, cinnamon and bay leaves. After this add the prepared paste and mix.
5. Mix turmeric powder, salt, red chilli, coriander powder, garam masala well and fry for 2 minutes.
6. Add water to it and cook it with the lid on till it reaches a perfect consistency.
7. When the gravy becomes a little thick, turn off the flame and take it out in a serving bowl and enjoy with your biryani.

title: Instant Mango Pickle Recipe
method: 1. First of all, wash the raw mangoes properly. Then chop them into bite sized pieces.
2. Add salt, mix well and keep it aside.
3. In a pan, dry roast fenugreek seeds and grind into a coarse powder.
4. Heat gingelly oil in a kadhai. Add mustard seeds, let it splutter slowly.
5. Ps: The heat should not be too high, it should be low to medium so that mustard seeds can splutter slowly.
6. Now, add hing, fenugreek seeds powder, Kashmiri chilli powder, turmeric powder and switch off the gas.
7. Mix it well.
8. Add the spices mix to the mango
9. Mix it well. Instant mango pickle ready! Serve it with paratha, rice or anything of your choice!

title: Suji Cheese Balls Recipe

ingredient.description: A pinch of salt and pepper

method: 1. In a pan, heat some water and let it boil.
2. To this add salt, red chilli powder and pepper. Then to this add some suji.
3. Once it cooks let it cool down.
4. Then take a small portion of it, flatten the mix, add the cheese in the middle and make roundels. Fry these balls and enjoy!

title: Alphonso Mango Cremeux With Exotic Fresh Wild Berries Recipe
method: 1. Cream the butter and cheese together and keep it aside. E
2. Meanwhile take a saucepan add Mango pure and Ellen and Vire cream together, cook it until it reaches boiling point. E
3. Remove it from the stove, add water-soaked gelatin sheet in it and stain the mixture. Keep it aside until it reaches room temperature. E
4. Fold the butter and cheese mixture into it and mold it. E
5. Keep it deep freeze for 3 hours. E
6. Glaze it with mango ganache E
1. Cook sugar and water till soft boil stage. E
2. Add melted chocolate and stir. E
1. Boil the cream and pure together. Remove the mixture from stove add chopped chocolate mix it well and add soaked gelatin sheet in it and stain it. E

title: Sabudana Chips Recipe
method: 1. Soak the sadudana in water overnight.
2. Boil water in a pan. Add the soaked sabudana. Season it with salt, pepper and lemon juice.
3. Let it cook for 10-15 minutes. Once the sabudana has further expanded and the texture is mushy, remove it from flame.
4. Spread a plastic sheet, pour out sabudana mixture using a spoon. This should be about the size of the chips you desire. Make sure you leave equal distance between each serving.
5. Let this dry in the sun for almost a day. The chips are ready, they can be stored in an airtight container for about a month.
6. Heat oil in a kadhai. Deep fry the chips. Make sure you add some pressure on each chip while frying, allowing every sabudana to pop.
7. The chips are ready!

title: No Oven Garlic Bread Recipe
method: 1. First of all, dissolve sugar in a quarter cup of lukewarm water, add yeast to it and mix it and keep it aside for some time.
2. Now take all purpose flour in a big bowl, add salt, garlic powder and oregano and mix it.
3. In this time the yeast will become fluffy, add it to the maida and mix it and knead a soft dough. Pour some oil on the dough and once again knead it and keep it aside.
4. The flour will get ready in 15 minutes. Grease your hands with oil and knead it again.
5. Now take out a portion from the dough, sprinkle some all purpose flour and roll it into a circular shape. Add cheese and boiled corn to one side.
6. Apply oil on the edge and fold its other side. Apply a lot of butter on it with the help of a brush.
7. Sprinkle oregano, chili flakes and garlic powder on it and make light cuts.
8. Turn on the gas and place a pan on it. Put salt in the pan and heat it, keep a bowl or stand in the middle of it.
9. Place the prepared garlic bread on a baking tray and place it in a pan to be baked.
10. After placing the baking tray in the pan, put a lid on it and let it bake for 15 minutes. After this take out the baking tray and serve sliced.

title: Mango Suji Cake Recipe
method: 1. First of all, pre heat the oven at 170 degree C.
2. Now mix sugar, salt and baking powder with suji (semolina).
3. Add oil in the mixture and mix well. Add the mango pulp and mix again.
4. Set it aside for 10-15 minutes. Semolina will soak all the flavours of mango till then.
5. Place the mixture into the greased baking tray.
6. Bake for 30-35 minutes.
7. Allow the cake to cool down. Serve and enjoy!

title: Restaurant-Style Gravy Recipe
method: 1. Take a pan and heat some oil.
2. To this, add black peppercorns, dry red chillies and bay leaf.
3. Once it heats, lower the gas and add chopped onions. Fry the onions properly till golden brown.
4. Then add chopped ginger and garlic. Let it cook.
5. Now, add finely chopped tomatoes. Cook them till soft.
6. Next, add a little bit of salt and mix again.
7. Till it cooks, take some dahi and mix red chilli powder, turmeric powder, and coriander powder.
8. Put this in the pan with the onion-tomato masala and stir quickly.
9. When the oil starts separating from the mix, add a bit of water and cook again.
10. Once it reaches the consistency you desire, throw in your other ingredients and cook the dish!

title: Mango Salsa Recipe
method: 1. Take onions, red chilli, coriander leaves and spring onions in a bowl.
2. Add mangoes to it.
3. Sprinkle lemon juice, salt, black pepper, olive oil and mix.
4. Garnish with pomegranate pearls and serve.

title: Cheese Baked Penne With A Kolhapuri Jhatka Recipe

ingredient.description: Red chilli flakes ( as per taste )

method: 1. Start by heating the cooking oil in a wok or a pan over medium flame. Once the oil is steaming toss in the chopped onions and sliced garlic.
2. When the onion starts turning translucent bring to flame down to low and continue sautéing it for another 3 minutes or so .
3. Sprinkle the red chili flakes , oregano and add in the tomato sauce and Kolhapuri Jhatka sauce.
4. Continue to sauté for a few minutes. Then pour in the puree and add the salt. Keep it simmering for 15-25 minutes till it starts to boil and thicken.

1. Cook as per directions on the packaging. Once done , add the pasta to about three fourths of the pasta sauce and mix till all of the pasta is doused in sauce. Reserve some of the sauce for layering.

1. Transfer the pasta and sauce into a baking dish and spread it evenly. Sprinkle and cover the pasta with half of the grated mozzarella and all of the processed cheese . Then top it up with the sauce that you reserved . Finish by adding left mozzarella.
2. Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
1. Bake for 10 minutes until the saucy is bubbly and the cheese all melty on the top and crusty on the sides. Take the dish out of the oven and sprinkle some parmesan cheese or cracked black pepper.
2. Your baked decadence is ready to be served!

title: Amritsari Paneer Pakoda Recipe
method: 1. Take gram flour in a large bowl, and add rice flour, refined flour, asafoetida, carom seeds, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, lemon juice, salt, water to it. Mix it and keep it aside.
2. Now, take paneer; add salt over it and mix it. Dip the paneer pieces in batter and deep fry them.
3. Let it fry over a high flame and take it out on a plate, once it turns golden brown.
4. The pakoda is ready! Garnish it with some dried mango powder .

title: Coconut Milk Based Mushrooms With Herb Rice Recipe
method: 1. Drizzle some oil and then add 2 tsps chopped garlic, 1 tsp of red chilli flakes along with a bowl of steamed rice.
2. Now add 2 tsps of black pepper powder and 1-1.5 tsp of Garlic Marinade.
3. Squeeze 1-1.5 tsps of lime juice and cook the rice.
1. Drizzle some oil in pan. Add 2 tsps freshly chopped garlic & half cup chopped onions.
2. Add a bowl of chopped mushrooms. Now, add red chilli flakes and mix everything well.
3. Add a tin of coconut milk for giving it a creamy texture. Add 1.5 tsp of Smokey Garlic Marinade.
4. Transfer to a bowl and garnish with parsley.

title: Aloo Paneer Pakoda Recipe
method: 1. Take paneer and cut it into thick slices. Keep it aside.
2. Now take mash potatoes and mix them with red chilli powder, salt, pepper, chaat masala. Combine it.
3. Then once the mashed potato mix is ready, take some of it and cover the paneer with it.
4. Mix some besan, salt and water in a bowl.
5. Dip the aloo paneer mix in it and fry till crisp and brown.
6. Once done, take it out, cut it from the middle and serve!

title: Mango Jamun Phirni Recipe
method: 1. Soak the rice in water and ground it.
2. Boil milk, add rice and cook it until the rice gets completely boiled.
3. Add sugar. Then add mango pulp, cardamom powder and cook it.
4. Remove from fire and chill it in the refrigerator.
5. Make gulab jamun as per the recipe.
6. Now, pour the mango phirni into the raitha container (60-65 grams).
7. Garnish with 3 half gulab jamun (20 gram) and pista flakes.

title: Mushroom Ghee Roast Recipe
method: 1. Combine the mushrooms with yoghurt, turmeric powder, and lemon juice in a dish.
2. Then add dry red chillies, peppercorns, cloves, methi seeds, coriander seeds, and cumin seeds to a pan over medium heat. Dry roast for about five minutes.
3. Add the roasted spices, garlic cloves, and tamarind paste to the mixer jar and blend into a smooth paste with a little water.
4. Heat a kadai, on medium flame. To this, add the ghee and curry leaves.
5. Next, add in the marinated mushrooms along with the marinade and cook.
6. When mushrooms look cooked, throw in the ghee roast masala, jaggery and mix. Once done, serve and enjoy!

title: Aloo Chokha (Bengali-Style Aloo Bharta) Recipe

ingredient.description: Potatoes, deskinned and cut into 4 pieces

method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and add kalonji and red chillies to it, let it splutter.
2. Add the chopped onions and fry until they turn light brown.
3. Mash the boiled potatoes and add to the kadhai and mix until it turns greasy. Adjust salt as per taste.

title: Tok Dal (Bengali-Style Raw Mango Dal) Recipe

ingredient.description: Raw mango, deskinned, deseeded and sliced
Salt and sugar, as per taste

method: 1. Boil the masoor dal with some salt, turmeric powder and green chilli. Keep aside.
2. Heat mustard oil in kadhai and add red chilli and mustard seeds. Let it splutter.
3. Add the mango slices, sugar, some salt and mix. Add a little water and close the lid to let it soften.
4. Add the dal and boil for some time. Adjust salt and sugar as per your taste.

title: Kathiawari Aloo Chana Chaat Recipe
method: 1. Take boiled chana chaat in a pan and add in red chilli powder, turmeric powder, salt and crushed green chillies.
2. Then to this, add sugar and some tamarind pulp.
3. When it heats up, throw in the boiled potatoes with cornflour slurry and cook.
4. Once it is done, take it out in a bowl and top with finely chopped onions, sev, papri and chaat masala! Serve to relish.

title: Oats Dahi Ke Kabab Recipe
method: 1. Take hung curd in a bowl, add salt, chilli powder, black pepper, garam masala, green chillies, cilantro and mix well. Now, add oats powder and mix again.
2. For Stuffing: Take a separate bowl, add raisins, cashew nuts, grated paneer, chaat masala, pinch of sugar and garam masala along with salt.

3. To make the dough, mix all the ingredients mentioned in the first step. Now, pull out tiny round pieces from the dough and fill it with the stuffing mixture (second step). Roll the kebabs properly.
4. Fry the round pieces in a Tawa until golden brown. PS: You can also shallow fry the kebabs instead of deep frying.
5. Sprinkle some chaat masala over the top and serve the hot oats dahi kebabs with mint chutney and enjoy!

title: Tapioca Chips Recipe
method: 1. Take tapioca, slit the skin by running knife holding it lengthwise. Cut into two. Using a flat spatula, tear off the skin.
2. The thick layer should be taken out. Wash well and keep immersed in water for 15 mins.
3. Pat dry the tapioca with clean kitchen towel.
4. Heat oil in kadai. Using a sharp mandolin slicer, slice the tapioca over hot oil.
5. Once sound and bubbles reduce, stir well and cook in medium flame.
6. Give some time for the sound and bubble reduce completely. Edges will turn golden in colour.
7. Chips will be light and you will hear the crispness while stirring. Drain from oil and repeat to finish.
8. You can also slice the tapioca in a plate and drop in oil instead of directly doing it. But do not keep sliced tapioca for so long. Just simultaneously while one batch is getting fried.
9. Once all the chips are done, sprinkle required salt and red chilli powder. Toss well to coat.
10. Tapioca chips are ready!

title: Chikar Chole Recipe
method: 1. In a pressure cooker, add water to the chickpeas and cook till it gets completely dissolved.
2. Now sieve the chickpeas, keep the water aside. Separate a little bit from the boiled chickpeas.
3. Take boiled potatoes and chickpeas and make a smooth paste by adding some water in a blender.
4. Heat four tablespoons of oil in a pan. Add ginger garlic paste and all the whole spices and fry for two minutes.
5. Add onion paste and fry it till it turns light golden in color. Simultaneously, add the prepared paste of potatoes and chickpeas and fry them.
6. Now add red pepper, coriander, turmeric, salt and cumin powder and fry it while mixing the spices.
7. Add curd and mix it well with spices. After a while, add boiled chickpeas to this mixture and cook for 2 minutes.
8. Add the remaining water of chickpeas to it and cover and cook for five minutes. Add amchur, black pepper and kasoori methi and mix.
9. Mix finely chopped green chilies and green coriander and take it out in a serving dish and serve it with naan or rice.

title: Killer and George Chutney Recipe
method: 1. Using a blender, blend all the ingredients (except Salt and Yogurt) until smooth.
2. For ‘Killer Chutney’ Season as per taste. Add a bit more of Lemon juice, sugar or salt, as needed.
3. Take half of the Killer Chutney and add Yogurt to it, to make George Chutney
4. Serves 5-6 people, depending on consumption.

title: Paneer Kohlapuri Recipe

ingredient.description: small Stone flower (patthar phool or dagad phool) - optional
½ to ¾ cup water for grinding
to 1.25 cups water or add as required

method: 1. Heat a pan and dry roast all the whole spices first on a low flame - cinnamon, cloves, black peppers, coriander, cumin, stone flower, tej patta, nagkesar (cobra's saffron), red chilies, nutmeg powder, green cardamoms and black cardamom seeds.
2. Dry roast till the spices become fragrant on a low flame, stirring often.
3. Once the spices become fragrant, then add poppy seeds, sesame seeds and desiccated coconut.
4. Stir continuously non stop and dry roast till the coconut gets golden. Remove the pan from the flame. Also remove the dry ingredients in another plate or tray.
5. In the same pan, heat 2 tablespoons oil and add ¾ chopped onions.
6. Saute the onions till light brown or golden.

7. Then add chopped garlic and ginger. Sauté till the raw aroma of ginger-garlic goes away. Then add coriander leaves. Mix very well and saute for half a minute. Then switch off the flame. Let this onion mixture cool down.
8. Take the roasted whole spices and sautéed onion mixture in a grinder jar. Add ½ to ¾ cup water and grind to a smooth paste. Keep aside.
9. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in the same pan.
10. Then add finely chopped tomatoes. Stir and saute till the tomatoes turn pulpy and soft. Oil should release from the sautéed tomatoes.
11. Now add the spice powders - ¼ teaspoon turmeric powder, ½ teaspoon kashmiri red chilli powder and a pinch of asafoetida.
12. Mix the spice powders very well with the tomatoes. Now add the kolhapuri masala. Mix very well with the tomatoes and saute for 2 to 3 minutes on a low flame.

13. Add 1 to 1.25 cups water. Instead of adding water directly to the pan, add some water in the grinder jar and rinse it very well, so that the remaining masala gets mixed with water. Then add this masala mixed water in the pan.
14. Season with salt as required. Salt in this recipe has to be right. If less salt is added, you do not get the flavor of the spices.
15. Bring the gravy to a simmer on a low to medium flame for 7 to 8 minutes. In between do stir, so that the masala does not stick to the base of the pan.
16. You should see some specks of oil floating on the gravy. This means the gravy is done. Then add paneer cubes (200 grams). Simmer for a minute. Switch off the flame.
17. Serve this spicy paneer kolhapuri with chapatis or phulkas or bhakri. Garnish with some coriander leaves while serving. Accompany it with some sliced onions and lemon wedges.

title: Herb and Garlic Ghee Infused Veggie Pasta Recipe

ingredient.description: Vegetables Chopped as per the requirement

method: 1. Boil the pasta in lightly salted water and little bit of oil/ Garlic Ghee so the Pasta doesn’t stick to each other, drain the water and keep the boiled pasta in a bowl.
2. Heat the Garlic Ghee in a large non-stick skillet over medium low heat.

3. Chop the vegetables as per the requirement into small bite-sized pieces and add them to the skillet, stir it till you feel that they are properly cooked. Add Salt while cooking. Keep in mind to check the Salt since the pasta is boiled in salt water.
4. Add the pasta to the skillet and season it with dried herbs, and pepper. Toss it well to combine and let it all rest for a few minutes to stick together a bit.
5. Grate some cheese over the pasta and delicious pasta is ready to serve.

title: No Bake Apple Pie Recipe

ingredient.description: gms Digestive/ Whole Wheat Crackers/Low carb Cheese crackers

method: 1. Combine coconut oil and graham crackers with some water in a blender and blend until the mixture is lumpy and sticking together. Lay in a cake tin and allow to sit in the fridge.
2. Heat a non-stick pan and grease with a bit of coconut oil/ vegetable oil.
3. Peel and slice the apple and put it into a thick bottom pan with water stevia, star anise, lemon juice and cinnamon.
4. Cook them until the apples are not completely soft.
5. Lay over the set digestive crust and put it into the fridge for an hour to set.
6. Place the cooked apples over it and garnish with your favourite nuts.

title: Matka Pulao Recipe
method: 1. To begin with the recipe, wash and soak basmati rice. Once done, pressure cook the rice until 70% done. Then put mustard oil in an earthen pot, add whole spices along with chopped veggies and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add ginger garlic paste and saute again.
2. Now, add curd and mix everything again. Then remove half of the gravy in a bowl. Spread the layer of cooked rice on top of the remaining gravy.
3. Now layer the rice with the remaining gravy.
4. Spread mint, coriander leaves and fried onions on the top
5. Close it with a plate and seal it with wheat flour dough.
6. Put the matki on the stove under very low flame
7. Keep it on low flame to avoid burning
8. Serve with raita and mint chutney.

title: Mushroom Noodles Recipe

ingredient.description: tsp Black pepper or white pepper
tsp Rice vinegar or regular vinegar

method: 1. Start by boiling noodles al dante, and keep them aside.

2. Heat oil in a wok or kadai or a pan. On a low to medium heat, first add chopped garlic, chopped ginger and chopped green chilies. For a spicy hot tasting noodles, you can increase the quantity of green chilies.
3. Saute for a few seconds, then add chopped spring onions. Add both the white and green part. Reserve 2 tablespoon of the greens for garnish.
4. Stir and saute the spring onions till they turn translucent. Then add the sliced mushrooms.
5. Stir the mushrooms very well and saute them on a medium to high heat stirring occasionally. The mushrooms will leave water while cooking.
6. Continue to saute till all the water dries up and the mushrooms become light golden from the edges.Then add ground black pepper.
7. Add soy sauce and stir very well. Add the noodles. Add salt as required.
8. Stir and toss the noodles very well. Add rice vinegar or regular white vinegar. Stir and mix. Switch off the heat and lastly add the chopped spring onions greens.
9. Give a final stir and serve mushroom noodles plain or with dry veg manchurian or veg manchurian gravy or veg balls in hot garlic sauce.

title: Khoya Kulfi Recipe
method: 1. Take milk in a pan and after it comes to a boil, reduce the flame.
2. Cook the milk till it becomes half. Now add khoya, sugar, cardamom powder and almonds, pistachios and cook while mixing.
3. Cook for 5 to 10 minutes and let it thicken a bit. Switch off the gas and let the mixture cool down.
4. After the mixture cools down, pour it into the kulfi molds and keep it in the fridge to set overnight or for eight hours.
5. After setting, keep the mold outside or in a vessel with water for some time, take out the kulfi comfortably and serve.

title: Dahi Chana Chaat Recipe
method: 1. Take boiled chickpeas in a bowl, add chopped onions, tomatoes, potatoes, green chillies and green coriander on it.
2. Add chili flakes, cumin powder, black salt, white salt and chaat masala.
3. Add green and sweet chutney and mix everything well.
4. Now add curd, crush papdi and put it on it.
5. Serve garnished with green coriander.

title: Paneer Makhani Pizza Recipe
method: 1. You first need to prepare the makhani gravy. For that, heat oil/ghee in a pan, add the cumin seeds, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon stick and sauté till cumin seeds sizzle, careful not to burn the whole spices, just roast them.
2. Now, add the garlic chunks and sauté for a few seconds. Once done, add in the onions, and cook for 5 minutes or till translucent.
3. Add the turmeric powder and red chili powder and mix everything well.
4. Now is the time to add the tomato puree. Cook on low for 10 minutes, till the oil separates.

5. Add the cream, sugar (optional) and ginger powder. Bring to a simmer. Cook for another 5-10 minutes. Add garam masala and kasoori methi. Remove from flame. Let it cool for a few minutes and then puree to it.

1. Take a large bowl, add the yogurt, lemon juice, ginger garlic paste, oil, red chili powder, kasoori methi, coriander powder, garam masala, cumin powder, turmeric powder and mix it well. Mix until a smooth paste.
2. Add the paneer cubes and marinate the paneer with the mixture. Keep for 15 minutes. Broil in the oven for 8-10 minutes.
1. Preheat oven to the maximum temperature your oven allows. Transfer the pizza base to a square piece of parchment paper.
2. Butter or oil the top a bit, and then spread the makhani sauce.
3. Add the broiled paneer, onion rings and bell peppers. Top with grated cheese (as much as you want). Add a dollop of butter/olive oil on top of it.
4. Wait and enjoy!

title: Mix Pakoda Platter Recipe
method: 1. Chop onions, potatoes, cauliflower, paneer and spinach leaves. Wash them all properly.
2. Now in a bowl, add besan, salt, red chilli powder, ajwain, dhaniya leaves, garam masala and some water.
3. Make sure that the batter has flowy consistency.
4. Once that is done, dunk your vegetables in this batter, and deep fry them in hot oil.
5. Take it out once crisp and brown. Serve and enjoy!

title: Avocado Toast Recipe

ingredient.description: Slices Sourdough bread or multigrain bread
good drizzle extra virgin olive oil

method: 1. Cut the avocado in half and carefully remove its stone, then scoop out the flesh into a bowl. Squeeze in the lemon juice then mash with a fork to your desired texture.
2. Season to taste with sea salt, black pepper and. chilli flakes
3. Toast your bread, drizzle over the oil then pile the avocado on top.
4. Avocado toast is ready!

title: Dahi Vada Chaat Recipe
method: 1. You first need to make vadas by blending soaked dal. Once done, take a spoonful of batter and deep fry. Continue doing it with rest of the batter.
2. Once all the vadas are deep-fried, soak them in the water again. Your vadas are ready.
3. Now, take a big plate, arrange some papdi, bhallas and pour some beaten dahi over it. Next, drizzle the date and imli chutney and the green chutneys around each of the papdi and bhalla.
4. Sprinkle chaat masala powder and cumin powder. Next sprinkle the grated carrots, pomegranates and the crispy boondi and sev.
5. At last, sprinkle the chopped onions and the chopped coriander leaves. The chaat is now ready to be served.

title: Talbina Recipe
method: 1. Wash barley well and soak for 3-4 hours.
2. In a pan, bring milk to a rolling boil and add the soaked barley.
3. Let it boil for 10 minutes.
4. Now add chopped and deseeded dates for sweetness. If you are using honey, add honey in the last step.
5. Cook for 10 more minutes.
6. Add chopped nuts and dry fruits of your choice once almost done.
7. Serve hot and enjoy!

title: BBQ Rice Recipe

ingredient.description: to taste Fine sea salt and black pepper
tbsp Tomato paste not tomato puree or sauce
tbsp Worcestershire sauce or vegan alternative
Fine sea salt and black pepper
¼ – ½ cup water as needed
tsp Greens from the leek or green onion

method: 1. Boil the rice, make sure it is not sticky or mushy. Keep this aside.
2. In the meantime, prepare the rest of the dish. Chop the onions. Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Cook the onion until translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Finely chop the garlic and the leeks, add to the pot and cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring often.
4. Chop the peppers and the tomatoes. Add them to the pan and cook for another 2-3 minutes.

5. In a small bowl mix together all the ingredients for the BBQ sauce except the water. Add to the pan, stir in ¼ cup water, cover the pan and simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring a few times in between.

6. Check the pan. If the sauce seems dry, add the remaining ¼ cup water and stir well. Continue cooking for another 5 minutes or until the vegetables are soft and the sauce has thickened nicely without becoming dry.
7. Add the drained rice, stir well. Adjust the taste with salt, pepper, and, if necessary, with a pinch of sugar and/or more vinegar.
8. Garnish with chopped tomatoes, green onions, parsley, or chives.
9. The dish is ready!

title: Mango Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl, mix together cream/Greek yogurt, cardamom powder, sugar, and mango puree (finely smashed mango pieces also work). Let it chill in the fridge.
2. Take bread slices and cut the brown edges.
3. Spread the chilled cream mix on the bread slices, place 4-5 mango slices on each bread, and sandwich with another slice of bread.
4. Keep in the fridge for 5 mins more if you want or enjoy it as is!

title: Potato Rings Recipe
method: 1. In a pan add some butter, garlic, chilli flakes and oregano. Then once it is cooked add some water.
2. Let it boil and add rava.
3. Once the rava soaks the water, allow it to cool down.
4. Next, add two mashed potatoes to it and form a dough.
5. Flatten out this dough and cut out small rings from it using a cutter. Or, you can also cut long strips from it and then make a circle from it.
6. Sprinkle some cornflour and deep fry till crispy.

title: Unicorn Easter Eggs Recipe

ingredient.description: gram Chocolate Coated Butter Scotch Pearls

method: 1. You would require a large egg mould for this.
2. Melt the dark chocolate compound in glass bowl over double boiler. Make sure it does not over heat.
3. Pour the melted dark chocolate in the plastic mould and coat it well. Turn over the mould and empty out the excess chocolate. Leave to set and dry.

4. Once the shells are ready, pour the hazelnut ganache around 30 grams and cover with dark chocolate. Once the dark chocolate is set, fill it with rainbow pearls, chocolate coated butter scotch pearls, chocolate balls and gems.
5. Stick both the shells together.
1. Mix all the ingredients together until fluffy.
1. Take fresh cream in saucepan, bring it to boil and pour on milk chocolate. Mix well then add chocolate hazelnut spread, monin syrup and set it aside.
2. Use unicorn colours in the butter cream and garnish the easter eggs.
3. Green, yellow, purple, red, blue, torquoise colours, you can use for Easter garnish.
1. Take a bit of fondant roll it and dust with golden spray.

title: Manchow Momo Soup Recipe
method: 1. You first need to finely chop all veggies like cabbage, carrot, onion and capsicum followed ginger and garlic.
2. The next step is, take a large vessel, fill it with water and add all these veggies into it.
3. Bring it to a boil.
4. Now is the time of adding seasonings and sauces like soya sauce, vinegar, green chilli sauce, red chilli sauce along with salt and pepper.
5. Simmer for about 5-6 mins.
6. Sprinkle some coriander leaves and there you get your soup ready.

title: Paneer Fingers Recipe
method: 1. To make Paneer Fingers, first you have to cut the paneer lengthwise.
2. Now sprinkle ginger garlic paste, red pepper, coriander, chaat masala and salt on the paneer and mix it lightly and let it marinate for 15 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, prepare a thin batter by mixing all purpose flour, cornflour, black pepper, chilli flakes, oregano and salt.
4. Take the pieces of paneer and coat it one by one with all purpose flour and then dip it in the batter.
5. After dipping in the batter, roll it in bread crumbs and put it on a plate.
6. All Paneer Fingers are ready to fry. Fry Paneer Fingers on medium flame and enjoy with hot mint chutney or ketchup.

title: Dahi Phulki Recipe
method: 1. First of all, you need to prepare gram flour batter. Add water in gram flour (besan) and keep it aside for 10-15 mins
2. Then take a small portion out of it and dip in hot oil, fried until crispy.
3. Then take a large bowl, fill it with water and drop all the fried pakoras in it and wait until they float.
4. Now, prepare the curd base. Take curd in a large container and beat it nicely. Add salt (remember we have already added salt in phulki so adjust accordingly).
5. Add cumin powder and mix well with curd.
6. Once done, take a wide serving bowl. Take out the phulkis from water and put them in the serving bowl.
7. Garnish the besan ki dahi phulki with red chilli powder, cumin powder, black salt, imli chutney and mint chutney.

title: Veg Dum Biryani Recipe
method: 1. Take a vessel and add oil to it. Throw in chopped onions and let them become crisp.
2. Then, add bay leaf, cinnamon, jeera, star anise, elaichi and cook.
3. To this, add ginger garlic paste and let it cook.
4. Next, add chopped vegetables such as carrots, cauliflower, beans, peas, and potatoes and mix them well.
5. Combine this with red chilli powder, pepper, salt and biryani masala.
6. Now add some curd and let it cook for a while.
7. Till then, take cooked rice and put a layer of it in a bowl.
8. Add the veggies and repeat the process.
9. Finally, garnish with dry fruits and crisp onions to enjoy!

title: Sitaphal Kheer Recipe
method: 1. Remove the pulp of the custard apple. Remove the seeds and mash it.
2. Boil milk in a thick bottom pan. Add a pinch of saffron to it.
3. Once the milk has slightly condensed, add the fruit pulp to it. Stir and cook for some time.
4. Put sugar and allow to cook for a minute.
5. Finally, add cardamom powder and turn off the stove.
6. Slice the almonds and garnish them over the kheer.
7. Serve chilled.

title: sabudana toast Recipe

ingredient.description: Cups Squeeze the soaked water from the sago and drain it.

method: 1. First of all, wash and soak the sabudana, then drain its water.
2. Dry thoroughly and take sago in a bowl. Add mashed boiled potatoes, samak flour, peanuts, all spices and salt to it.
3. Heat a small spoon of oil in a tempering pan, prepare a tempering of cumin, asafoetida and ginger.
4. Put it on the sago mixture and mix everything well.
5. Now grease the toaster with oil, take a little mixture from the sago mixture and spread it in the toaster.
6. Close the toaster and wait for it to cook well. Remove it after roasting and serve with peanut chutney or tea.

title: Chana Dal Pulao Recipe
method: 1. First of all, soak the chana dal for 2 hours. This will make the dal soft and cook easily.
2. Heat oil in a pressure cooker and fry all the whole spices, whole red chilies for two minutes and then fry the onions till they turn light golden.
3. Add ginger garlic paste and fry, add tomato puree, coriander powder and turmeric powder and fry well.
4. Now add lentils and rice to it and mix well with spices. Put two glasses of water and cover the cooker.
5. After two whistles turn off the gas and wait for the pressure to release.
6. Open the pressure cooker and take out the chana dal pulao in a serving bowl and serve it with chutney.

title: Vrat-Friendly Paneer Makhani Recipe
method: 1. For the makhani gravy, boil the tomatoes with some cashews and chilli powder.
2. Let it cook properly and then blend into a fine paste.
3. To a kadhai, add the tomato paste with some ghee, jeera powder & coriander powder and let it cook.
4. Then add in the paneer cubes and mix it in with the gravy.
5. Garnish with some fresh cream.

title: Almond And Amaranth Kebab Recipe
method: 1. Roast almond in preheated oven at 180 degree celsius for 4 minutes and cut them roughly once cooled.

2. In a bowl, combine amaranth flour, almond flour, roughly chopped almonds, chopped ginger, chopped onion, chopped green chili, mashed potatoes, salt, red chili powder, garam masala powder and chopped coriander leaves. mix thoroughly.
3. Portion the mix in 25 gm size and keep aside in plate.
4. Heat oil in pan on medium flame, pan fry kebabs to golden and crisp.
5. · Serve hot kebabs with chutney.

title: Almond And Cauliflower Rice Salad Recipe
method: 1. Roast the almonds with skin in preheated oven at 180 degree celsius for 4 minutes and cut into slivers, once it is cooled.
2. In a pan, heat olive oil and crackle cumin seed, add chopped ginger, chopped green chilli and saute for 10-15 seconds.
3. Stir-in pulsed cauliflower and cook for a minute or till tender.
4. Take off the pan from flame and finish up with lemon juice, freshly chopped coriander and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
5. Add roasted slivered almonds to it.
6. Serve fluffy textured pulao.

title: Watermelon And Sweet Potato Salad With Broiled Quinoa And Shikanji Dressing Recipe
method: 1. Prepare two big slices of watermelon and add 2 tbsp of dressing on it so that it gets soaked in. Keep it for 20 minutes in a fridge
2. Cut the sweet potato (skin less) into dices and boil them till done up to 90 percent. Pat dry them and remove access moisture. Heat ghee in a pan and fry them, till golden brown.
3. Quick boil the quinoa and strain it. Let it cool and then broil it in a hot pan to attain crispy texture.
4. Place the watermelon on a plate and top it with the sweet potatoes and quinoa.
5. Drizzle the remain dressing and finish with micro greens and serve.
1. Mix all the ingredients to make a fine dressing.

title: Sabudana Tikki Recipe
method: 1. To make this scrumptious Navratri special recipe, soak sago (sabudana) in water for around 2 to 3 hours. When the sago has turned a little fluffy, drain the excess water and transfer the sago to a bowl.

2. Now to prepare the tikki mixture, take a big bowl and add the boiled potatoes to it. Mash them completely using your hands. Now add crushed roasted peanuts, chopped green chillies, coriander leaves, red chilli powder and sendha namak along with the drained sago.
3. Make small tikkis of this potato and sago mixture. The tikkis should not be soggy. Now take a pan and add ghee to it. Heat it over moderate flame.
4. Once the ghee is sufficiently hot, carefully place the sago-potato tikkis in it and fry till they turn crispy and brown in colour.
5. Serve hot with Imli chutney and mint.

title: Healthy Paneer Pizza Recipe

ingredient.description: Oregano and red chilli flakes to taste

method: 1. Make pizza sauce by cooking tomato puree with all the spices and basil in olive oil.
2. Spread the sauce on pizza base.
3. Top it with onions, tomatoes, capsicum, mushrooms and olives.
4. Grate and splay paneer on top of it.

title: Soya Pulao Recipe
method: 1. First of all, soak soya chunks in hot water for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes, squeeze the soya chunks out of the water and separate them.
2. Now take soya chunks in the vessel, add curd, red chili, ginger garlic paste, coriander powder and mix it well and keep it aside for some time.
3. Heat oil in a pressure cooker, add all the whole spices, whole red chilli and fry for a few seconds. After this add chopped onion and fry for few seconds.
4. Add marinated soya chunks with onions and fry for some time. After this add chopped tomatoes and green chilies and cook it till it becomes soft.
5. Add red chilli powder, coriander powder, garam masala, turmeric and salt as per taste and cook everything well.
6. Add the soaked rice to the spices, mix it well and cover the pressure cooker with water as needed.
7. After two whistles, turn off the gas and after the pressure is released, take out the prepared casserole in a serving bowl and serve it. Pair it with raita or chutney.

title: Yogurt, Amaranth And Chia Seeds Parfait With Fruits Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half Cup Low Fat Yoghurt, hung curd
Walnut, flax seeds and mint for garnish

method: 1. In a bowl, whisk the yoghurt and honey until you form a smooth paste. Add chia seeds and popped amaranth.
2. Cut the fruits into bite size pieces. Take a parfait glass/ bowl and add a layer of fruits followed by a layer of yoghurt mix.
3. Top this layer with flax seeds, walnut and mint. Enjoy!

title: Roti Nashta Recipe
method: 1. Take your Rotis and tear them into small bite-size pieces. Add these rotis to a bowl and pour in four to five tablespoons of water.
2. When it is wet enough, mash them.
3. Now add grated onions, capsicum, carrots, coriander leaves and more as per your choice.
4. Next, add salt, red chilli and pepper.
5. Combine everything well. Then, once a dough-like consistency is ready, make small roundels from it and fry!
6. Once it is golden brown and crisp, take it out and enjoy!

title: Burmese Samosa Curry Recipe
method: 1. In a pan heat some oil and add the powdered spices one by one, ginger garlic paste and let it cook for some time.
2. In another bowl add curd, besan flour and 1 cup water to make a smooth and lump free mix.
3. Get back to the pan and half of the shredded veggies and pulses and lightly fry them.
4. Add the curd and besan mix and let it come to a boil.
5. Once everything has been boiled and cooked once well, add the remaining pulses and stir again.
6. Pour the hot soup into a bowl, add 2 small samosa, shredded veggies and fresh coriander leaves for garnish and enjoy.

title: Hyderabadi Paneer Curry Recipe
method: 1. To prepare this delicious dish, take a pan with ghee and dry roast the cumin seeds, clove, black pepper, sesame seeds, red chillies. Then, add them to a mixer and grind them properly.
2. Then, heat oil in a pan and saute the paneer cubes and set aside.

3. Heat the oil in a separate pan and add curry leaves and onion to it. Saute them from a few minutes until the onions turn light brown. Now, add minced ginger and garlic along with the ground masalas.
4. Then, add milk to the pan and cook for a few minutes.
5. Finally, add the fried paneer pieces and lemon juice. Simmer for about 10 minutes.
6. Once cooked, transfer the dish to a serving bowl and serve hot.

title: Parsi Falooda Recipe
method: 1. In a jar, pour water and throw in the basil seeds. Wait for few minutes to let the seeds swell up.
2. Pour milk over it, mix in rose syrup.
3. Pour into glasses and top with ice-cream scoops.

title: Aloe Vera Ki Subzi Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, wash the leaves and remove the thorns. Once done, slit lengthwise and make thin strips almost like ribbon size. It will help absorb more flavours.
2. Now pressure cook the leaves with little water until one whistle.
3. Mix dry ingredients like dhania powder, turmeric powder, amchur, salt, a little jaggery and a little water. Now, pour it into hot mustard oil and roast till it looks glazed. Keep stirring.
4. In another pan, add hing, oil, cumin seeds, broken dry red chillies and let them crackle. Add the boiled Aloe Vera strips and toss them well. Now add this mix to the roasted masala.
5. Add some raisins, chopped green chillies, coriander leaves, toss and mix it well.
6. Finally, sprinkle a little bit of mustard seeds (rai) powder and mix again. Let this subzi rest for 2-3 hours before serving.
7. It tastes great the next day!

title: Malabar Paneer Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in a kadhai, saute onions, tomatoes, capsicum and green chillies for 3-4 minutes.
2. Add hing, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, chilli powder and salt. Mix it well.
3. Pour the coconut milk and let it cook in the seasoning.
4. Add the paneer cubes to the coconut gravy, cover the pan with a lid and cook it slowly for 3-4 minutes.
5. The Malabar paneer is ready!

title: Protein Balls Recipe
method: 1. Place the almonds in a food processor and pulse until they are finely chopped.

2. Add the apricot, dates, honey and orange zest and pulse until a dough consistency is achieved. Roll one heaping teaspoon of dough into little ball then roll the ball through desiccated coconut. Set aside. Repeat until all the dough is used up.
3. The energy balls can be stored in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 1 week.

title: Dry Fruit Malai Recipe
method: 1. Take a bowl and add malai. Now whisk malai for a few seconds.
2. Mix in powdered sugar until it dissolves.
3. Now, add the milk and stir well.
4. Combine the apple, banana, cardamom powder, almond, cashew, and pistachio in a food processor. Combine it.
5. The delectable Fruit Malai Dessert is prepared and ready to serve.

title: Street-Style Cheese Maggi Recipe
method: 1. To start with, heat butter in a pan and fry onions, bell pepper and green chillies.
2. Add tomatoes to it and cook.
3. Now add garam masala, red chilli powder and the noodles pre-mix. Cook until the mix leaves oil.
4. Add 2 cups of water and break the noodles cake in it. Cook the noodles.
5. Finally, add grated cheese and close the lid for half-a-minute.
6. Serve hot.

title: Paan Rabri Falooda Recipe
method: 1. Soaked the basil seed overnight.
2. In a food processor put in the roughly cut paan and little milk, blend it nicely.
3. Take a pan, boil rest of the milk with sugar and saffron.
4. Now, put in the prepared paan puree and cook the milk till sugar dissolved properly.
5. Cool the prepared milk and mix it with rabri nicely.
6. Take a serving glass, put a ladle of prepared rabri, next add soaked basil seed on top of the rabri.
7. Do the same process again.
8. Now, add gulkand and a scope of paan ice cream on the top and glass and garnish with pistachio slivers and truti fruity.

title: Pot Pie Biryani With Coriander Curry Recipe
method: 1. Wash the rice under running cold water till the water runs clear. Soak into enough water for at least 30 minutes.
2. Heat the oil or ghee in a pan on medium heat. Add whole spices and fry till you get a nice aroma from them.
3. Add onions and fry till onions get golden. Add ginger –garlic paste and fry till they turn fragrant.
4. Transfer tomatoes, curd, red chilli powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder ,mint leaves , coriander leaves ,salt, and turmeric.
5. Cook till tomatoes turn soft and pulpy and also the mixture begins to leave the oil.
6. Add the soaked, drained rice and cook for a minute. Add water and let it come to a boil.

7. Once it starts boiling add saffron and cover the pan and lower the heat to the lowest possible. Cook for 17-20 minutes without opening the lid. After 20 minutes turn the heat off, do not open the lid, keep it covered and rest for around 30 minutes.
8. For Veg Preparation
9. For the vegetables, cut all the vegetables into batons except eggplant. Blanch it and keep it aside. Cut the eggplant into quarters till the stem and deep fry till it becomes crispy.
10. Roast the vegetables, with a little garlic, oil, salt and pepper.
1. Take a pan, add Ghee, once it is hot, add onions, coriander bunch and sauté it. Add cumin and coriander powder, salt, garam masala and cook it till it starts leaving the oil.
2. Add water in the pan and cook till the water evaporates. Blend it to a smooth puree and add cream.
1. Dissolve yeast and sugar in hot water in a bowl. Let stand until yeast forms a creamy foam, 5 to 8 minutes.
2. Mix 1 3/4 cup flour and salt in a large bowl. Pour in yeast mixture; mix well until dough comes together.

3. Transfer dough to a floured surface and knead until smooth, adding remaining 1/4 cup flour if dough is too sticky, about 2 minutes. Roll dough into a 12-inch circle. Transfer to a greased 8-inch pie tin.
4. Bake at a high heat oven for 8 to 10 min till golden.
1. Put the rice in the pie, top it with the vegetables and serve it with the hot nihari sauce.
2. Garnish it with fresh rose petals, mint leaves and fried onions.

title: Chocolate Cranberry With Chantilly Cream Recipe
method: 1. Melt both the chocolates separately and keep aside.
2. Wash the Strawberries and pat them dry. Scoop out the center and trim the base.
3. Dip each strawberry in the dark chocolate and keep on the side. Let the chocolates firm up.
4. Put white chocolate in a piping cone and drizzle white chocolate on the chocolate covered strawberries.
5. Prepare Chantilly cream by scraping the vanilla pod to the cream, add sugar and essence, whip till stiff peaks are formed. Pipe it in the scooped out strawberries.

title: Melting Moments Recipe
method: 1. Bring milk to the boil with cream, and vanilla Pod.
2. Mix milk and dark chocolate to above mixture, cook it down and set it in the chiller for 30 mins.
3. Melt 15 gms of dark chocolate and line the silicon moulds with dark chocolate set it in the refrigerator for 10 mins.
4. Pour the above mixture in the lined silicon moulds, keep it for setting in the freezer, once set put chocolate on open side and again keep for setting in the freezer.
5. Once set, demould and serve.

title: Mix Vegetable Idli Recipe

ingredient.description: tbsp Garlic and ginger garlic paste.

method: 1. Take a bowl, add gram flour and semolina.
2. Then add salt, capsicum pcs, tomato, green chilli, ginger-garlic paste, chopped green garlic, chopped carrot, green peas, chopped coriander, and curd.
3. Let it rest for about 15-20 mins.
4. Once done, add paneer and mix again.
5. Now, grease the idli moulds with oil. Fill a portion of the batter.
6. Steam for about 10-12 mins. Check if the idlis are cooked or not by using a toothpick.
7. Serve and enjoy!

title: Suji Medu Vada Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl add semolina, ginger, green chilli, onion, cumin, green coriander, curry leaves and salt as per taste and mix everything well.
2. Now add curd and a little water to it and make a thick batter.
3. Add fruit salt or sweet soda to it before making vada.
4. Heat oil in a pan and grease your hand with oil and make the shape of a vada and fry it till it becomes crispy golden.
5. Enjoy it with chutney or sambar.

title: Beetroot Pulao Recipe
method: 1. Soak rice in water for at least half an hour.
2. Fry cumin seeds in hot oil; saute onions, green chilli and ginger-garlic paste.
3. Saute tomatoes, salt and all the spices.
4. Add chopped beetroot and potatoes and rice.
5. Add water and let it all cook. Serve hot.

title: Straw Protein Smoothie Recipe
method: 1. Add all Ingredients to a blender. Blend well to get the perfect texture.
2. Serve in a bowl or glass and enjoy

title: The Twisted Smoothie Recipe

ingredient.description: Glass of milk OR ½ bowl of yogurt

method: 1. Add all Ingredients to a blender. Blend well to get the perfect texture.
2. Serve in a bowl or a glass, top up with your favourite fruits and enjoy!

title: Maggi Bhel Recipe
method: 1. Coarsely crush the Maggi.
2. Heat oil in a pan and roast the coarsely crushed Maggi.
3. Take all the other ingredients in a bowl (except sev, anar dana and some coriander leaves).
4. Mix everything well.
5. Add sev and roasted Maggi to it and mix.
6. Garnish with pomegranate and coriander leaves and serve.

title: Tandoori Aloo Bharta Recipe
method: 1. First of all, take hung curd in a bowl, add ginger, garlic paste, green chili paste, red chili, black pepper, coriander powder, gram flour and tandoori masala and mix it.
2. Add boiled potatoes to it, mix and put in a baking tray and bake for 30 to 40 minutes.
3. Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin, cardamom and black pepper seeds to it. Add onions and fry for 2 minutes.
4. Add ginger garlic paste and fry it for some time. Add tomatoes and fry, now add red chili, finely chopped green chilies, coriander powder, salt as per taste and tandoori masala and mix
5. Add a tablespoon of curd and mix it well. Add kasoori methi. Now add the baked potatoes and mix.
6. Garnish with green coriander and serve.

title: Gajar Patta Gobhi Vada Recipe
method: 1. Soak urad dal for 4 hours, grind to make thick paste.
2. Add rest of the ingredients and knead to make light dough.
3. Divide the dough into small balls.
4. Flatten the balls with hands and make a small hole in the centre with finger.
5. Deep fry the vadas and serve hot.

title: Pizza Bread Roll Recipe
method: 1. To begin with the recipe, chop some veggies like capsicum, onion and carrot.
2. Now on a flat surface, Flatten the bread by using the rolling pin. Spread some pizza sauce/ tomato ketchup and mayonnaise.
3. Stuff it with cheese, veggies, some seasonings and form a log shape.
4. Dip the bread rolls into the beaten eggs, and then into the breadcrumbs. Deep fry until golden brown.
5. Now, dry with tissues or paper towels. Serve and enjoy!

title: Cabbage Cutlet Recipe
method: 1. Wash and strain the grated cabbage, add the chopped coriander, onion and garlic. Mix it well.
2. Next, add all the masalas – chaat masala, red chilli powder, cumin seeds, salt and pepper powder.
3. Add the corn flour and half of the sooji at first, mix it well. Then gradually add the rest. Combine the mixture well and let it rest for at least 10 minutes.
4. Make round-shaped cutlets and shallow fry them till both sides are golden brown.
5. The cabbage cutlet is ready!

title: Bubble Potato Chips Recipe
method: 1. Start by cutting thin round slices of potato, you can do that using a knife or even a slicer.
2. Now place all the slices on a flat surface, with each slice at even distance from another.
3. Make sure you have an even number of potato slices as you’ll need to place them on top of one other, in pairs.
4. Sprinkle salt on top of all the slices.
5. Now, sieve corn flour on half of the potato slices. Brush the other of half of the potato slices with egg white.
6. Place each egg washed potato slice on top of corn flour bathed potato slice.
7. Next, deep fry the slices till they puff up and turn golden brown.
8. Bubble potato chips are ready!

title: Veg Thukpa Soup Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in a wok, add the chopped onion and garlic. Once the onion turns translucent, add the other chopped veggies such as beans, carrots, cabbage and green onions along with salt. Mix everything well.
2. Now add seasonings like garam masala, sweet chili sauce, soya sauce, chilli sauce and mix again.
3. Add vegetable/chicken broth and let it simmer for 4-5 mins.
4. Add the chopped cilantro and mix well and simmer it again for 4 to 5 minutes.
5. Finally, add the boiled noodles and cumin powder. Mix them well and let it simmer for a min or so.
6. Serve and enjoy!

title: Instant Oats Dosa Recipe
method: 1. First, roast the oats lightly. Now let it cool down and add some fenugreek seeds to it and make powder.
2. Take out this powder in a bowl, add one spoon of semolina and rice flour to it.
3. If you do not have rice flour, then you can also add a spoonful of wheat flour to it. One spoon curd, salt as per taste, black pepper, asafoetida, curry leaves, grated ginger. Mix all the things.
4. Make a good consistency batter by adding water as per the requirement. Let it rest for 15 to 20 minutes, now add finely chopped green chilies, curry leaves and finely chopped onions.
5. Flip the other side and bake lightly and serve with chutney or sambar.

title: Chilli Idli Recipe
method: 1. You can use leftover idli or you can also use fresh idli to make chilli idli.
2. Take idlis and cut them into desired shape. Make a thin batter by mixing corn starch, all purpose flour, salt, pepper and ginger garlic paste in a bowl.
3. Heat oil in a pan, coat the idlis well in the batter and fry them in oil till they turn crispy golden.
4. After this, heat oil in another pan, add finely chopped garlic, green chili and onion and fry it lightly.
5. Add capsicum, black pepper and a little salt to it. Now add red chili sauce, ketchup, vinegar and soy sauce to it.
6. Cook all these things for few seconds. Add corn starch liquid to it and mix. After this add fried idli and mix it well. Serve garnished with green onions.

title: Tamatar Feta Cheese Katlama Recipe
method: 1. Add corn flour & roasted chana powder to warm salted water, mix all the ingredients.
2. Knead dough and let it stand 10-15 min.
3. While dough is setting, put butter in a pan on a slow fire.
4. Take small quantity of dough mixture in the heated pan and press with fingers till it becomes thin(2cm).
5. Cook on slow fire till the colour becomes brown.
6. Garnish with tricolor julienne of capsicum and spring onions or you can also use carrot, raddish and capsicum.

title: Sooji Besan Halwa Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, heat ghee in a pan. Once the ghee melts, add sooji (semolina) and sauté until it turns light brown.
2. Then, add gram flour and sauté for 3-4 minutes on high heat, stirring continuously to avoid stickiness. Add saffron and mix.
3. When the sooji, besan and ghee mixture turn light brown, add milk slowly and keep stirring.
4. Reduce heat, cover and cook for a minute or more.
5. Add green cardamom powder and sugar and mix till the sugar dissolves.
6. At last, garnish with almond and pistachio slivers and serve hot.

title: Tri Colour Ravioli with Goat Cheese, Pumpkin and Sage Recipe
method: 1. Prepare 3 different pasta dough by mixing ingredients in separate bowls as per recipe, add water as required. Make a firm dough. Cover with cling film and let the dough rest for 30 mins.
2. Cut Pumpkin, cut them into cubes, season with salt, pepper and olive oil and roast in the oven for 20 mins at 180 C till they are soft and caramelized.
3. Mash pumpkin with a fork, add olive oil, toasted pinenuts, sage and goat cheese. Season with salt and pepper.

4. Roll the pasta dough in to thin sheets, spoon the pumpkin mixture and add wrap with a second pasta sheet. Seal the stuffing and cut them into round or square shapes. Blanch the stuffed pasta in boiling hot water for 4 to 5 mins.
5. Prepare the sauce by sautéing the pumpkin in butter, confit garlic and chopped sage, adjust seasoning as required, Spoon over the blanched ravioli, garnish with shaved parmesan. Serve Hot

title: Gajar Dhudi Kaju Bites Recipe
method: 1. Grate Carrots, Sauté in half ghee till some moisture evaporates, add milk and let it cook till the carrots have become soft and the milk has almost evaporated.
2. Add sugar to the remaining ghee and the toasted nuts and raisins.
3. Grate Dhudi and sauté in half ghee, cook till moisture evaporates and the mixture has become soft.
4. Reduce the milk and then add to the dhudhi mixture and cook it further till the milk has evaporated. Add sugar, ghee and cardamom. Adjust seasoning accordingly. Add toasted nuts to the mixture.
5. For the Kaju mixture, mix sugar and water and boil rapidly, add the ground cashewnuts and cook on low heat till the mixture leaves the sides of the pan, add cardamom powder.
6. Pour it on a pan and slightly knead the mixture. Spread on a greased tray and roll it to the desired thickness.
7. To assemble the bites place the dhudhi halwa in the bottom of the pan then the kaju mixture and top with gajar halwa. Leave it in the refrigerator for 1 hour for the mixture to set.
8. To serve cut them into squares and garnish with toasted nuts.

title: Tandoori Bharwan Capsicum Recipe
method: 1. Cut and deseed capsicum. Apply little oil and sprinkle some salt. Keep it aside.
2. In a pan heat some oil and add ginger garlic paste, chopped onions. Chopped vegetables like carrots and cauliflower, but this is optional.
3. Add mashed potatoes and paneer and all the other dried spices and peanuts.
4. Mix well until everything is well incorporated. Take off the heat and some chopped coriander leaves too.
5. Dab the capsicum dry and fill with the stuffing.
6. In a non-stick pan. Drizzle little oil and roast both sides of the capsicum not more than 2-3 minutes.
7. Once the exterior starts getting slightly charred, remove from heat and serve hot.

title: Paneer Gravy Roll Recipe
method: 1. Heat some oil in a pan, add two roughly chopped onions and add garlic, ginger and whole spices to it.
2. Add roughly chopped tomatoes and curd. Fry it for a while and add whole red chilies, green chilies to it.
3. Add red chili powder, coriander, turmeric and salt and fry it well. After the masala is cooked, cool it and make a smooth paste in the mixture.
4. Take a pan, heat some oil in it, add kasoori fenugreek, after that put the prepared paste in it and cook it.
5. Sprinkle garam masala on it, keep the prepared gravy aside.
6. Now take paneer, cut some paneer from it and keep it aside. Take out the remaining square slices of paneer and spread them on a plate.
7. Take paneer, crush it. Heat a pan, add some oil, add finely chopped onion and fry it lightly.
8. Add crushed paneer to it, prepare a stuffing by sprinkling red chili, coriander, salt and garam masala.
9. Spread the prepared stuffing on the paneer slices and roll them, if you like to roast them- then heat a little ghee on the pan and now you can roast them lightly.
10. Here we are putting them in the same gravy. Serve garnished with green coriander.

title: Wild Rocket And Roasted Tomato Pizza Recipe
method: 1. Spread the pizza with tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese.
2. Spread pizza sauce followed by mozzarella cheese again over it.
3. Cook in the wood fire for 4-5 minutes.
4. Place the vegetables rocket leaves, parmesan shavings and roasted sliced tomatoes and drizzle with olive oil and serve.
5. Cut to desired shape and serve hot.

title: Corn Poha Recipe
method: 1. Boil the corns and keep aside.
2. Wash poha and drain the water.
3. Heat oil in pan, add mustard seeds. When they start to splutter, add curry leaves. Saute for a minute.
4. Saute onions, green chilli and ginger-garlic paste.
5. Add tomatoes, salt, red chilli powder and turmeric powder. Saute till cooked.
6. Add boiled corns and mix well. Add poha, drizzle some water. Mix well and serve with the garnishing of coriander leaves.

title: Pongal Recipe
method: 1. Wash rice 2-3 times with fresh water and soak it in the water for ½ hr. Wash dal and roast it in a pan for 3-5 min with 1 tsp of ghee .
2. Add roasted dal-soaked rice (drain the water) and water, and cook it on a low heat till it becomes soft in texture and mushy. Add water if needed.
3. To get creamy consistency, add some hot water to bring it to a consistency you like. Add salt if needed and stir well.
4. In a pan make the tempered mix using ghee, cumin seeds and crushed black pepper, ginger, curry leaves, green chili, and asafoetida. Sauté for some time.
5. Then add turmeric, cooked moong dal and rice. Sauté for some time until the moong dal becomes aromatic .
6. Pour another 250 ml of water and salt. Slowly mix well and cook it again on slow fire. Just ensure that the bottom of the pan is clear.
7. Once done, serve with sambhar or chutney.
8. As some people like little runny, you can adjust the consistency by adding more or less water.

title: Khas Khas And Gud Ki Panjiri Recipe
method: 1. Heat pan, when hot add white sesame seeds and roast until golden brown
2. Heat pan again and add ¼ of ghee and fry above frying ingredients, one by one keep aside.
3. Fine chop cashew nut, almond, raisins.
4. Heat pan and roast wheat flour till brown.
5. Add remaining ghee in a pan. When ghee melts add chopped dry fruits, green cardamom. Than add wheat flour, roasted and all ingredients.
6. When hot add crushed jaggery. Remove from fire and mix well. Panjiri is ready.

title: Kathal Korma Recipe

ingredient.description: large Chopped and fried crisp onions

method: 1. Wash and soak almonds and cashews in hot water for 10 minutes. Peel off the skin of almonds, mix cashew and curd and make a fine paste. Keep it aside.
2. In a pan add ghee and whole spices, once they start to splutter, add jackfruit chunks and fry for a couple of minutes.
3. Now add ginger garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone.
4. Once the ginger-garlic paste and jackfruit chunks have mixed well, add coriander, cumin, red chili and turmeric powder and mix.
5. After around 2 mins add the curd and almonds paste and cook until the masala starts leaving oil.

6. Next add the crushed fried onions and mix well for some time. Once the masala looks cooked, add around 2 cups water and pressure cook it for 3-5 whistle depending on the texture of the jackfruit you are using.
7. Check once if the jackfruit chunks are soft, if not simmer for a while. End with adding either kewra or rose water and let it sit with the lid on for 2 minutes.
8. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

title: Suji Gulab Jamun Recipe
method: 1. Heat a pan, add sugar along with water and wait for it to dissolve. Keep stirring until a consistent paste.
2. Now add 1/2 tsp elaichi powder and 1 tbsp milk to prevent sugar from crystalizing.
3. Sugar syrup is ready. Keep it aside.
4. Now heat another pan, add ghee and roast semolina on low-medium flame. Wait until it turns aromatic and its colour changes.
5. Now, add sugar and boiled milk (it should be hot) followed by cardamom powder, keep stirring on low flame until milk is absorbed.
6. Once done, cool the mixture and transfer it to a bowl.
7. Now, spread some oil/ghee on your palm and start making balls from the dough.
8. Heat oil in a pan and deep fry these balls. Keep frying until the balls turn brown and golden.
9. Drop the deep fried Gulab jamuns in the prepared sugar syrup.
10. Wait for 30-40 minutes Serve and enjoy!

title: Sarson Makki Saag Recipe
method: 1. First, wash and finely chop 1 bunch mustard leaves (sarson ke patte) and ½ bunch spinach (palak). Add bathua leaves.
2. Take the chopped leaves in a pressure cooker along with chopped garlic, ginger, ¼ onion, 2 chilli and ½ tsp salt.
3. Add 1 cup water and pressure cook for 4 whistles.
4. Mash until coarsely ground.
5. Further add 2 tbsp of makki ka atta and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes or until the mixture thickens. keep aside.
6. Now in a large kadai, heat 2 tbsp ghee, and saute 2 clove garlic, 1 inch ginger and 1 green chilli.
7. Next saute 1 onion until it turns golden brown. Add in cooked and mashed leaves and mix well.
8. Continue to cook for 4-5 minutes, or until the saag is cooked completely.
9. Finally, enjoy sarso ka saag with makki ki roti or with chapati.

title: Til Halwa Recipe
method: 1. Soak sesame seeds overnight and make a smooth paste. Keep aside.
2. Heat ghee in kadhai and add sooji to it.
3. Roast it until the sooji turns golden in colour.
4. Lower the flame and add til paste. Stir it continuously to avoid any lump.
5. Once you see the til turns golden (not brown) in colour, add water to it.
6. Stir and bring everything to boil.
7. When you are satisfied with the consistency, add powdered sugar, cardamom powder and mix.
8. Finally, add the dry fruits, mix and switch off the flame.
9. Serve it hot or cold.

title: Madrasi Dosa Recipe
method: 1. To make the dosa batter, soak rice, parboiled rice, urad dal, chana dal, tur dal and methi seeds in a large bowl with enough water for 4-5 hours.
2. Soak the poha or flattened rice in one third cup of water for at least half an hour before grinding the dosa batter.
3. Once done soaking, grind all these ingredients together.
4. To make potato masala, heat oil in a heavy bottomed vessel. Now, add mustard seeds and as they begin to splutter, add urad dal and allow the dal to turn red.
5. Add curry leaves, green chilies and ginger and mix for a few seconds. Add the sliced onions and saute for 5-6 minutes on low to medium flame.
6. Add the turmeric powder and mix. Add the boiled potato cubes and mix well.
7. Grind the roasted red chilies, roasted garlic, dalia (roasted gram dal), onion pieces, grated coconut, tamarind, sugar and salt to a fine paste. Remove to a bowl, add a tsp of oil and mix well.
8. To make the dosas, heat a non stick dosa pan on high for 20 secs.
9. Reduce flame to low and pour 2 ladles full of dosa batter in sweeping circular motion. Use the back of the ladle to spread it in thick concentric circles.
10. Drizzle oil along the edges of the dosa, drizzle melted butter or ghee all over the dosa. Cook the dosa on medium flame till the base begins to brown.
11. Place a ladle full of potato masala on one half side of the dosa, fold the dosa over the potato filling and remove to a serving plate. Prepare dosas with rest of the dosa batter.

title: Creamy Spinach Soup Recipe
method: 1. Heat the water and boil the spinach leaves till soft.
2. In a blender, blend the spinach and water.
3. Sieve the puree.
1. In a non-stick vessel, heat the olive oil, add the oregano, spring onions and saute for ½ minute.
2. Add the spinach puree, milk, salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 2 minutes.
1. Serve hot.
2. Garnish with cheese and croutons.

title: Whole Wheat Bread Spinach Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a pan and add the diced onions, sauteing till golden brown.
2. Add baby spinach and cook till it wilts.
3. Add the fresh dill, parsley, garlic and pepper and combine.
4. Empty into a bowl and add the ricotta, feta and combine into a mixture. Add cheddar slices to Wholewheat. Bread and top with spinach and cheese mixture.
5. In a pan, add extra virgin olive oil and unsalted butter and toast the sandwiches till the cheese melts. Serve hot.

title: Roti Garlic Bites Recipe

ingredient.description: to taste Salt and pepper as per taste

method: 1. In this recipe, first, take a bowl and melt some butter in it.
2. Then add chopped garlic, salt, pepper, red chilli and give it a mix.
3. Next, take the leftover rotis and cut them into small triangular pieces. Once they are ready, spread them on a baking tray.
4. From the top, add the garlic and spice mixture.
5. If you want, you can garnish it with cheese as well.
6. Now bake them till they are crisp like chips.
7. Once done, let it come to room temperature and then have them with any side accompaniment!

title: Hare Matar ki Shammi Recipe
method: 1. Blanch the green peas.
2. Put olive oil in a pan, add black cumin to it.
3. After, add green peas and sauté it till green peas gets dry.
4. Take it out of heat let it cool.
5. When it gets cool, add boiled and mashed potatoes, chopped coriander.
6. Make flat round cake (tikki / shammi).
7. Take oil in a fry pan and stir fry the cake (tikki / shammi).
8. Serve hot and garnish as per your liking.

title: Kabuli Pinni Recipe
method: 1. Powder sugar and keep it aside.
2. Heat ghee in a pan or kadhai or a thick bottomed deep pan. Add chickpea flour and stir for 3 - 4 minutes or until it turns light brown and becomes aromatic.
3. Transfer it to another plate and keep aside. (It will be in liquid form but no problem. When you add khoya and sugar it will harden.)
4. In another kadai, dry roast crumbled khoya until it becomes light brown in color. Stir it constantly so that it does not stick to the bottom of the pan. (This will take around 5 - 6 minutes.)
5. Remove the pan from heat. Add fried flour.
6. Next add raisins, pistachios and almonds. Mix all the ingredients well and leave it aside for cooling.
7. Drizzle milk and mix once more. (This step is optional. Add milk only if you find it difficult to make balls. )
8. When the mixture is warm and manageable, then shape into round balls.
