9. Decorate with coconut. Let the pinnis cool completely before storing them in an airtight container.

title: 5-minute Poha Ladoo Recipe

ingredient.description: Handful of dry fruits (cashew nuts, raisins)

method: 1. Heat ghee in a pan and fry cashew nuts and raisins. Keep aside.
2. Fry the poha until it turns light brown in colour.
3. Transfer the poha in a grinder and grind into powder.
4. Add the jaggery, cardamom powder and grind again.
5. Transfer it in a bowl, mix the dry fruits and make small ladoos out of the mixture.

title: Chana Garlic Fry Recipe
method: 1. Soak chana for a couple of hours, then pressure cook with a little salt until 80% done.
2. Take out of the water and let it cool. Lightly smash each piece of chana and then deep fry until golden and crispy.
3. Lightly smash each garlic piece too and deep dry separately until golden and crispy.
4. Mix both the ingredients in a bowl and then add all the dried spices, you can increase or decrease the quantity according to your liking.
5. Shake and mix well and serve with chai or cold drink.

title: Bajra Raab Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl, add some warm water and let the jaggery soak for 5-10 mins.
2. Meanwhile in a pan, add ghee and cook the Bajra flour until the color has changed.
3. In a pan add the jaggery water mix and boil in low flame.
4. In the pan with bajra, add the jaggery water mix and some milk too. Mix well to make sure no clumps are left.
5. After cooking this for 5 mins, add ginger powder and elaichi powder. Drizzle shaved nuts for garnishing but that is optional.
6. Serve hot for breakfast.

title: Doodh Poha Recipe
method: 1. Soak the poha in water for a minute or two and drain out the excess water. Keep aside.
2. Boil the milk with cardamom and bay leaf.
3. Add the soaked poha in it and stir to avoid burning.
4. When you get the desired consistency, lower the flame and add jaggery or sugar and mix everything together.
5. Add the dried fruits and nuts and mix.

title: Dahi Paneer Recipe
method: 1. Toss the paneer pieces with turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chili powder, and salt.
2. Heat oil in a flat skillet over medium-high heat.
3. Arrange the paneer pieces on the skillet and fry from two sides until lightly browned. Remove on a plate.
4. Whisk yogurt with coriander powder, turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chili powder, garam masala powder, and cashew nut paste. Set aside.
5. You can add a tablespoon of chickpea flour (besan) or all-purpose flour (maida) to the yogurt to make a thicker and creamier curry.
6. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the remaining oil from frying the paneer to the same pan.
7. Once the oil is hot, add dry red chilies, green cardamoms, cloves, and cumin seeds and let them crackle for 4-5 seconds.
8. Add ginger and green chilies and fry for 20-30 seconds.
9. Now add the yogurt whisked with the spices to the pan.
10. Cook for 12-15 minutes and keep stirring continuously to avoid the yogurt from curdling.
11. Add the fried paneer cubes to the pan and cook for 4-5 minutes. You can add some water if the curry is thick for your liking.
12. Add salt and Kasuri methi and cook for another minute. Serve hot.

title: Butter Samosa Recipe
method: 1. Keep butter in the refrigerator.
2. Mix khoya, sugar, cardamom powder and dry fruits to make soft dough.
3. Roll out small rots with dough. Place a dollop of butter on the centre and secure the ends to make triangles.
4. Keep in fridge to set.

title: Amra Chutney Recipe
method: 1. Boil amra and take out the fruit. Smash to make pulp. Save the boiled water for later.
2. In a pan, saute whole red chilli, panch phoron and salt for a minute. Add amra pulp, mix well.
3. Add boiled amra water as per consistency desired. Add sugar and boil till you get a syrupy texture.
4. Serve amra chutney at room temperature.

title: Dahi Poha Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, wash the poha in running water.
2. Then transfer the poha in a bowl of dahi.
3. Mix everything together.
4. Transfer it to serving bowls and drizzle gud as much as you want.
5. Garnish with dry fruits and serve.

title: Mozzarella Sticks Recipe
method: 1. In a small bowl, mix the eggs and water.
2. Mix the bread crumbs and garlic salt in a medium bowl. In a medium bowl, blend the flour and cornstarch.
3. In a large heavy saucepan, heat the oil to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C).

4. One at a time, coat each mozzarella stick in the flour mixture, then the egg mixture, then in the bread crumbs and finally into the oil. Fry until golden brown, about 30 seconds. Remove from heat and drain on paper towels.

title: Hariyali Pulao Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half cup Basmati Rice

method: 1. Add mint, cilantro, ginger, garlic, and green chilies to a blender along with ¼ cup of water.
2. Blend to make a smooth paste. Set it aside.
3. Rinse rice with water 2-3 times until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in 4-5 cups of water.
4. While the rice is soaking, make the pulao.
5. Heat ghee in a pan over medium heat.
6. Once the ghee is hot, add cumin seeds, cloves, green cardamoms, black peppercorns, and a cinnamon stick and let them crackle for 5-6 seconds.
7. Add onions and fry until lightly browned (6-8 minutes).
8. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, Kashmiri chili powder, and garam masala powder and cook for 10-12 seconds.
9. Now add peas, green beans, carrots, and potatoes, and saute for another minute.
10. Drain the rice and add it to the pan along with lime juice, 2 and ½ cups of water, bay leaves, and salt. Add the green masala paste and stir gently.
11. Cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid and reduce the heat to low. Cook for 20-25 minutes until the rice is tender and all the liquid is absorbed by it.
12. Remove the pan from heat and let it sit for 5 minutes.
13. Fluff the pulao gently using a fork and serve hot.

title: Chilli Chaap Recipe
method: 1. First, take raw soya chaap and boil it. Cut it into pieces and deep fry.
2. Next, add oil, ginger-garlic paste, and dry red chilli to a pan. Mix it well.
3. Then add chopped onion and capsicum. Stir it, and add soy sauce, red chilli sauce, schezwan sauce, vinegar and some water. Let it come to a boil.
4. Now throw in the chaap pieces and combine.
5. Now, in a small bowl, add cornflour and water to make a slurry.
6. Throw this in a pan and let it boil. Once done, take it out and serve!

title: Mushroom Momos Recipe
method: 1. Knead dough with all-purpose flour, some salt and 1 tsp oil.
2. Saute onions and mushrooms in oil with ginger-garlic paste, green chilli, garam masala and black pepper powder.
3. Make thin, translucent small rotis from the dough.
4. Stuff the rotis with mushroom mixture. Secure the ends. Make round or spherical momos.
5. Steam the momos for 10-15 minutes.

title: Choco Christmas Pudding Recipe
method: 1. Butter ramekins and keep aside.
2. In a bowl, mix butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla essence, flour, almond flour, cocoa powder along with the raisins and tutti frutti mix. Add chocolate flavored syrup and mix until blended.
3. Pour the batter in the ramekins and place on a baking tray.
4. Bake at 160 C for 10 minutes, until the tops are firm and cracked but the chocolate beneath is hot and gooey.
5. Dust with icing sugar and drizzle caramel flavored syrup and serve hot.

title: Nutty Christmas Pudding Recipe
method: 1. Brush pudding cup to grease. Line the base with rounds of baking paper.
2. Sift combined flours, bicarbonate of soda, cinnamon, mixed spice and nutmeg into a large bowl. Add fruit mixture, butter, brown sugar and eggs and stir until well combined.
3. Gently spoon mixture into prepared pudding steamer, smooth top, and secure the lid.
4. Place pudding into a large saucepan. Pour in enough boiling water to combine halfway up the side of the pan.

5. Place over medium heat and bring to the boil. Cook, covered, topping up with extra boiling water if necessary, for 5 hours 30 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the pudding comes out clean.
6. Remove steamer from saucepan, and set aside for 10 minutes before turning onto a serving plate. Serve immediately with custard, ice-cream or brandy butter, if desired.
7. Combine the dried fruit, cherries, figs, pears, cranberries, dates, orange rind and juice in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
8. Cook, stirring, for 10 minutes, or until fruits soften. Remove from heat and set aside for 30 minutes to cool. Add the brandy and stir to combine.

title: Schezwan Dosa Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half Cup Dosa Batter

method: 1. To prepare the filling for dosa, heat oil in a wok then add ginger and garlic when oil becomes hot. Saute for just few seconds.
2. Now, add onions, green chillies and saute on high heat for 30 secs. Add capsicum, carrots, cabbage and beans. Fry them on high heat for 2-3 mins.
3. Veggies should remain crunchy. Add boiled noodles along with 2 teaspoon Schezwan sauce, tomato sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, pepper and salt.
4. Toss them well to coat everything with sauces nicely. Switch off the flame and mix in spring onion greens. Let the stuffing cool down little bit.
5. Now, heat a non stick griddle pan. Brush lightly with oil. Wipe it with a tissue. Pour one ladleful of dosa batter and spread it to make big dosa.
6. Smear some oil on sides and top of the dosa. Now, spread the Schezwan sauce nicely on the top of dosa.
7. Let the dosa become nicely crisp from bottom and cooked from top as well. No need to flip and cook the other side.
8. Place some stuffing on one side of dosa and carefully lift the other side and fold into half moon. Take it out on to a plate.
9. Similarly make other dosas.
10. Serve hot.

title: Atta Dosa Recipe
method: 1. To make this dish, first in a bowl mix wheat flour, rice flour, salt, slit green chillies, curry leaves, jeera and mix.
2. Then add water to it and make a smooth batter.
3. Once the batter is ready, pour a ladle full of it on a greased hot pan.
4. Let it cook from one side, then add some oil to another side.
5. Flip the dosa and cook till a crisp.
6. Lastly, take it out and enjoy!

title: Bread Patties Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl, add besan, red chilli powder, salt, cumin seeds, and water to form a smooth batter. Mic and keep aside.
2. Now in a pan add some oil, slit green chillies and mix.
3. Next throw in chopped onion and peas. Let it cook till onions are soft.
4. Now add mashed potatoes with salt, red chilli powder, pepper, chaat masalas and combine everything. Once it is done, let it cool for a while.
5. Then cut the bread slices in two, add the potato mix from the top, dunk it in the besan batter and deep fry.
6. Once it is done, take it out and enjoy!

title: Masala Hot Chocolate Recipe
method: 1. In a pan add milk and whole spices and let it boil. Right before it starts boiling, lower the flame and simmer for 2-3 minutes with the lid on.
2. Add cocoa powder and sugar and mix well.
3. Let this simmer for a min, take off the heat, and serve hot.

title: Ragi Khichdi Recipe
method: 1. Soak dal, rice and ragi in water for at least 1 hour.
2. Heat some ghee in a pressure cooker.
3. Roast cumin seeds till they crackle. Add turmeric powder, green chillies, and saute for a minute.
4. Add soaked dal, rice and ragi together with water. Add salt.
5. Pressure cook and serve after adding garam masala powder.

title: Sprouts Dosa Recipe
method: 1. First, take a bowl full of sprouts and add it to a blender with a tablespoon of water. Blend this mixture.
2. Once a smooth paste is formed, transfer it into a bowl and add rice flour, sooji, green chilli, salt, and water.
3. Combine to form dosa batter. Keep the batter aside for 15 minutes.
4. Now heat a pan and drop a ladle full of this batter to cook. Once it is brown and crisp, serve and enjoy!

title: Aloo Semiya Cutlet Recipe
method: 1. Heat ghee in a pan and roast the Semiya for 4-5 minutes or until golden.
2. Once done, boil the vermicelli for 2-3 mins. Then, drain the semiya and let it cool down.
3. Now, add corn flour in the vermicelli bowl and mix it well.
4. Now, add boiled potatoes, bread crumbs, ginger paste, green chillies, chilli flakes, cumin powder, garam masala, chaat masala and salt to taste.
5. Mix everything well. Take a small portion from the mixture, roll it like a cutlet (cylindrical shaped).
6. To prepare slurry, in a small bowl take 2 tbsp corn flour, 2 tbsp maida, 1/4 tsp pepper powder and tsp salt to taste. Add water to prepare smooth batter.
7. Now, dip cutlets one by one in the cornflour slurry, then roll in vermicelli.
8. Deep fry it on low-medium flame. Keep frying until cutlet turns golden and crispy.
9. Serve and enjoy!

title: Sprouts Curry Recipe
method: 1. In a pressure cooker, add some oil, add cumin seeds, let this crackle and then add ginger garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone.
2. Add onions, tomatoes and cook until mushy. Add sprouts and mix well.
3. Add the dried spices like haldi, red chili powder and salt. Mix well and close the lid to pressure cook for two whistles.
4. Take off the lid and simmer for some time.
5. Garnish with a spoonful of ghee and coriander leaves. Serve hot.

title: Dal Farra Recipe

ingredient.description: Cup Rice Flour/ Whole wheat flour

method: 1. In a bowl wash and soak chana, urad and matar dal for 2-3 hours.
2. Once done, put the dal mix in grinder. Add garlic and chilies too. Make a fine paste.
3. Mix salt, red chilli powder, haldi, garam masala and cumin seeds to the dal mix and let it sit.
4. Knead a soft dough with rice flour/whole wheat flour, water and some salt. Make tiny puri.
5. Place the dal mix on one side of the puri and fold with the other side.
6. Prepare a steamer and steam the Farra for around 20 minutes.
7. Once done, take off the heat and keep aside.
8. In another pan heat some oil, crackle mustard seeds, hing, curry leaves, add the steamed farra and sauté for a couple of minutes.
9. Cut in the middle or make rough three slices and enjoy.

title: Paneer Fried Rice Recipe
method: 1. First, take boiled rice. Next, cut the paneer in small cubes, toss it in corn flour and fry them until crispy. Once done, heat a wok and add oil.
2. To this add ginger-garlic paste, then add fried paneer cubes. Let the flavours mix.
3. Now throw in veggies life onion, carrots, capsicum and mushroom. Toss them well.
4. Then add red chilli powder and pepper. Now add soy sauce and mix again.
5. Check for salt, add as per your taste. Finally add the cooked rice and combine with everything.
6. Serve hot in a bowl and enjoy!

title: Aloo Do Pyaza Recipe
method: 1. Heat some oil in a pan. Lightly fry the diced onions, tomatoes and potatoes. Keep aside.
2. In the same pan, saute cumin seeds.
3. Add chopped onion, green chilli, and ginger-garlic paste.
4. When onions cook, add salt to taste, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and coriander powder. Mix well.
5. Add fried potatoes and mix well.
6. Add some water, cover the pan and let the potatoes cook for some time.
7. Lastly, add fried onions and tomatoes. Mix and serve.

title: Paneer Masala Fry Recipe
method: 1. Cut the paneer in small cubes.
2. Now in a bowl add red chilli powder, pepper, garam masalas, turmeric powder, coriander powder, ginger-garlic paste and mix.
3. Now add thick curd and combine it with the masalas. Finally add some lemon drops.
4. Throw in the paneer cubes and make sure that all the pieces are coated well. Let it rest for 15 minutes.
5. In a pan, heat some oil, add curry leaves, dry red chilli and let it splutter.
6. Put in the paneer pieces and cook from both the sides.
7. When it turns brown and crispy take it out and serve!

title: Oats Dahi Masala Recipe
method: 1. Take oats and boil it till it softens.
2. Till then, finely chop onions, cucumber, carrots, tomatoes and any other vegetable of your choice.
3. When the oats are ready put them in a bowl. Add in the veggies and curd and mix well.
4. Throw in spices like red chilli powder, pepper, and salt. Combine them together.
5. Now in a small pan, heat some oil and add mustard seeds, curry leaves, one dry red chilli, cumin seeds and urad dal.
6. When it starts to splutter, pour this in the oats bowl. Mix and enjoy!

title: Navratan Pulao Recipe
method: 1. Cook the rice about 80% and set aside for sometime.
2. Now, heat 1/4 cup oil in a kadhai over medium heat. When it is hot, add the potato pieces and fry them for 30 - 40 seconds.
3. Add chopped carrots and stir, continue cooking for about 30 seconds then add French beans and cook them with constant stirring until all the vegetables are slightly soft and mushy
4. Take them out of the oil. Use the same oil to fry the paneer until it becomes light brown and remove them once done.
5. Put cauliflower in the same kadhai and fry it till it becomes slightly brown.
6. Once the cauliflower is roasted, add boiled green peas (matar), cashews, raisins and almonds and fry them for about 30 seconds, stirring occasionally.
7. Add finely grated ginger, garlic paste, cloves, bay leaf, cinnamon and green cardamom and fry for 30 - 40 seconds while stirring continuously.
8. Add cooked basmati rice, salt, ghee and mix everything well, cook on a medium flame, stirring occasionally.

9. Heat ghee in another pan, when it gets hot, add cumin seeds and mix well. When the cumin starts spluttering, add saffron milk and 2 tablespoons water. When it starts boiling, add it to the pan with a pulao and mix well.
10. Add pre-fried vegetables like potatoes, carrots, French beans, cauliflower and paneer.
11. Mix everything well. Add lemon juice and mix well again. Cover the pan and simmer it on a medium flame for about 10 minutes.
12. Serve and enjoy!

title: Aloo Ke Gola Kebab Recipe
method: 1. To prepare this recipe, take a large container, add mashed potatoes along with grated veggies like beetroot, cabbage, carrot, capsicum and chopped coriander and green chillies. Mix everything well with the potato masher.
2. Now roast besan and maida for 3-4 minutes in a pan.
3. Add roasted besan and maida and bread crumbs in the mashed potato mixture. Add all the dry ingredients (masalas) mentioned in the ingredients list.
4. Mix again. Now, take a small portion from the mixture, round it like bondas and insert a tandoori stick or thick straw in the between the bonds and shape them accordingly.
5. Once shaped, take out the stick and repeat the same process.
6. Heat oil in a pan and fry the kebabs until brown.
7. Serve these aloo ke gola kebabs hot, with some ketchup or mint chutney by the side.

title: Lahsuni Bhindi Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in a pan or kadai. Keep the heat to low and first crackle the cumin first.
2. Add garlic and asafoetida (hing). Saute for 15 to 20 seconds or till the raw aroma of garlic goes away.
3. Then add the sliced onions and saute till they become translucent. Add turmeric powder, green chilies and stir.
4. Add the sliced okra (bhindi). Stir in salt. Cover the pan and let the okra cook for 5 minutes.
5. Remove the lid and add the red chili powder, garam masala, coriander powder, dry mango powder. Stir well.
6. Cook without any lid till the oil starts separating and the okra has cooked.
7. If the okra mixture starts to stick to the pan, then sprinkle some water and continue to cook. Stir for some times, when the okra is cooking.
8. Garnish with some coriander or mint leaves and serve with roti or phulkas or plain paratha or bread. It can also be packed in lunch box.
9. It can also be served as a side dish with dal-rice or curry rice or sambar rice combo

title: Soya Idli Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, soak dal, rice and soyabean separately in bowls.
2. Add methi seeds and chana dal together in the bowl of urad dal. Soak the rice atleast 5-6 hours.
3. Once soaked, grind all the ingredients together into a thick and consistent paste. Add a little bit of water and grind again.
4. Add the salt and stir well to combine. Cover the bowl and ferment the Batter for at least 6 hours or overnight.
5. Once fermented, mix again. Steam in an idli steamer and serve hot with sambar and nariyal ki chutney alongside.

title: Tawa Paneer Burger Recipe
method: 1. To make this burger, first, take a bowl and add curd, red chilli powder, pepper, salt and chaat masala and mix.
2. Put this prepared marinade on a slab of paneer and pan fry it till golden. Next, thinly cut tomatoes, onions and cucumber.
3. Take a bun and toast it in butter and a bit of red chilli. Now assemble the burger.
4. First add tomato ketchup on the base, and then add the prepared paneer.
5. Now put in the sliced veggies, top it off with one cheese slice.
6. On the other toast, add mustard sauce.
7. You can choose to add any of your favourite sauces in middle of the burger.
8. Serve it with fries and enjoy!

title: Mushroom Biryani Recipe
method: 1. For the biryani base, heat oil in a pan, add whole spices (jeera, both cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, star anise, bayleaf) along with sliced onions and ginger garlic paste. Saute for some time.
2. Once done, add tomatoes and wait until the tomatoes turn soft and mushy. Once done, add green chillies, red chilli powder, biryani masala or garam masala.
3. Then, add curd and saute again. Wait for 2-3 minutes until well combined. Now, add sliced mushrooms. Saute it for about 4-5 minutes.
4. Now, add the drained rice and pour water. Add salt and mix everything well.
5. Cover and cook on a medium flame until rice turns fluffy.
6. Pair this delicious biryani with a bowl of raita and salan.

title: Masala Vegetable Khichdi Recipe

ingredient.description: cup Chopped vegetables – Carrot, green peas, capsicum, cauliflower, etc.

method: 1. In a pressure cooker, heat ghee and add whole spices like bay leaf, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and jeera.
2. After they start to splutter, add ginger-garlic paste. After some time add chopped onions and tomatoes too.
3. After a minute add all the chopped vegetables and cook until they are slightly soft.
4. Add haldi, red chili powder, and salt and mix well.
5. Add rice and mix well. Add around 3-4 cups water and pressure cook for 5 whistles.
6. Take off the heat, garnish with freshly chopped coriander, some ghee, and serve hot.

title: Chatpati Chaap Roll Recipe

ingredient.description: A pinch of Salt, Sugar, Baking powder

method: 1. Add Maida and cooked Soya chunks in a bowl. Blend together and add salt & water to make it a dough.
2. Take a small dough and roll it on a flat surface like a chapati.
3. Take a container with boiling water and place the soya chaap sticks for 10 minutes until it slightly changes their colour.
4. Now, the Soya chap is ready for the next step.
1. In a bowl, add maida, Soyabean oil, salt, sugar, a pinch of baking powder, warm milk, and mix it well to make a soft dough. Let it set for half an hour.
2. Now, in a pan, add butter and small pieces soya chaap.
3. Add salt, black pepper, chaat masala, chopped onions, and stir it.
4. Then turn off the flame and keep it aside. Now, take the maida dough and start making small balls and make chapaati.
5. On a pan, roast the chapatti and spread coriander & tomato chutney on top with the mix veggies.
6. Garnish with onion, chaat masala, and half fried soya chaap with lemon juice.
7. And Voila your Chatpati Chaap Rolls are ready, Enjoy!

title: Chilli Garlic Potato Bites Recipe
method: 1. Grate the potatoes, keep them aside.
2. Heat a pan, sauté garlic and chilli flakes in oil.
3. Add rice flour to the pan let it cook for some time. Pour in water and mix it well till the rice flour becomes a soft dough. Remove it from heat.
4. In a mixing bowl, mix together grated potatoes and rice flour dough.
5. From this dough, roll out small bite-sized balls using your hands. Deep fry the balls.
6. Potato bites are ready!

title: Aloo Bread Pakoda Recipe
method: 1. Take three potatoes and mash them. Now in a pan add jeera and let it splutter.
2. Then add your mashed potatoes with masalas like red chilli powder, pepper, coriander powder and salt as per taste.
3. Combine and cook. Once done let it come till room temprature.
4. Till then prepare the pakoda batter by combining besan, water, a pinch of baking soda and some salt. Mix well.
5. Now take two pieces of bread and add in the prepared aloo masala and close it from top.
6. Slice it in two pieces and dip in batter. Now fry it in hot oil till golden brown.

title: Shevga Dal Masala (Maharastrian Dal) Recipe
method: 1. Wash the dal properly and soak for some time (preferable an hour).
2. In a pressure cooker, add the soaked dal, drumstick pieces, onion, ginger garlic, chili, and a couple of curry leaves. Pressure cook it for 3-4 whistles.
3. Let the pressure release naturally; now add a pinch of Kasuri methi to the dal.
4. In a pan heat ghee, once hot add asafoetida, mustard seeds, cumin, and curry leaves. Heat for some seconds and make sure not to burn this.
5. Add on top of the ghee and close the lid. Open the lid after a minute or 2 and serve hot.

title: Cheese Pakoda Recipe
method: 1. In a mixing bowl take ½ cup besan. Add the coarsely crushed black pepper and coriander seeds.
2. Add asafoetida, baking soda, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, sesame seeds and salt as per taste. Add 4 to 5 tablespoons water or add as required.
3. Mix to a smooth thick batter without any lumps.

4. Take 5 cheese cubes or 125 grams processed cheese or mozzarella cheese. Do note that the cheese cubes have to be removed directly from the fridge and then sliced. Do not use cheese cubes which are at room temperature.
5. Cut each cheese cube in two parts. Heat oil for deep frying or shallow frying in a kadai or pan. When the oil becomes hot, add 4 to 5 drops of the hot oil in the besan batter.
6. Mix it very well. This helps in making the pakoras crisp and they also absorb less oil while frying. Place the cheese cube in the batter and coat it evenly with the batter.
7. Now gently slid or place each batter-coated cheese cubes in the hot oil. Fry the pakoras on medium to medium-high flame.
8. When one side is crisp and golden, then turn over and fry the second side. Turn over again and continue to fry.
9. You can turn over a couple of times and fry till the cheese fritters are crisp and golden. However do note that do not fry these pakodas too much. Just fry them till they turn golden.
10. Remove them with a slotted spoon. Place them on kitchen paper towels to remove excess oil.

11. Serve cheese pakora hot with any chutney or dip or sauce of your choice. Do note that cheese pakoda has to be served hot. If they are served warm or at room temperature, the melted cheese becomes thick and solidified.

title: Pizza Cutlet Recipe
method: 1. Chop your veggies like capsicum, corn, onion, jalapenos, olives and paneer and add them to a bowl.
2. Now throw in chilli flakes, salt and oregano. Mix these well.
3. Next take mashed potatoes, and add the filling in middle of it then close it from the top.
4. Dip this in corn flour and breadcrumbs to deep fry. Once golden brown, take it out and enjoy!

title: Onion Sabji Recipe
method: 1. To begin the preparation of Rajasthani Kande Ki Sabzi, in a bowl, mix yogurt with water, and whisk until well combined.
2. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder & salt to the yogurt mixture.
3. In a pan, heat ghee, on medium flame, once it is hot, add in the cumin seeds and allow them to sizzle.
4. Now add ginger, garlic and green chillies and saute for about a minute. Stir well.
5. Add in the sliced onions and mix well. Continue to cook until the onions turn into a lovely brown colour.
6. Add the yoghurt mixture and increase the flame to a medium high and allow the onions to cook till the moisture has been absorbed.
7. Transfer the dish into the serving bowl.

title: Chilli Baby Corn Recipe

ingredient.description: to 3 green chilies – slit or sliced
cup Thinly sliced or finely chopped capsicum

method: 1. Rinse and dry the baby corn with kitchen towel. Chop the baby corn in halves if they are larger in size or keep them whole if they are smaller.
2. Prep the spring onions, garlic, green chillies, ginger, capsicum and set aside.
3. Make a smooth and medium thick batter with the cornstarch (cornflour), all purpose flour, salt, pepper and water.
4. Heat the oil in a wok or frying pan. Dip each baby corn piece in the batter and coat it well with the batter.
5. Gently place the batter coated baby corn pieces in the hot oil. When one side firms up and is crispy, light golden, turn over and fry the second side.
6. Fry the baby corn till the edges and sides are golden brown turning over a couple of times with a slotted spoon.
7. Place the fried baby corn on kitchen paper towels.

1. In another pan or frying pan or wok, heat about 1 tablespoon oil. Or you could use the same pan that was used for frying the baby corn – keeping 1 tablespoon oil in it, remove the remaining oil with a spoon.
2. Add chopped spring onions, ginger, garlic and slit green chilies.
3. Stir fry on a medium-high heat for 1 to 2 minutes. Now add the sliced capsicum (green bell pepper). If you do not have capsicum, you can skip it
4. Stir-fry on medium-high heat for 3 to 4 minutes until the capsicum is half cooked. It should have some crunch.
5. Lower the heat to medium and add the soy sauce, sweet green chilli sauce or sweet red chilli sauce. Mix well.
6. Now sprinkle black pepper powder, salt and sugar. Mix again.

1. Add the fried baby corn. Gently mix with the rest of the ingredients. You could stop here if you prefer a highly crispy and crunchy baby corn texture. But if you want a smooth glazed sauce coating on the baby corn then proceed to the following steps.
2. Add 2 to 3 tablespoons water and mix again. To give a glaze and smoothness in the dish, sprinkle about 1 teaspoon of cornstarch (cornflour).
3. Mix well and cook for 1 to 2 minutes or more till the cornstarch has cooked. Check the taste and add salt, pepper or soy sauce if required.
4. Serve the baby corn garnished with some spring onion greens or chopped celery.
5. You can serve chilli baby corn as a starter snack or with bread or as a side with stir fried noodles or fried rice.

title: Shakarkandi Tikki Recipe
method: 1. Rinse the sweet potatoes well in water. Roast them in the oven till they are cooked and soft.
2. Or else pressure cook with enough water & salt till they become soft.
3. You can also boil them in a pan with water & salt.
4. Drain the water. when they cool down, then peel them.
5. With a potato masher mash the sweet potatoes well.
6. Add all the ingredients except oil. mix well.
7. Shape into medium sized tikkis or patties.
8. Pan fry the tikkis with little oil till both the sides are browned. While serving garnish with some coriander leaves.
9. Serve sweet potato tikki!

title: Rajma Sundal Recipe
method: 1. To make this snack, first in a pan add some oil.
2. To this add mustard seeds and urad dal. Let it splatter.
3. Next add curry leaves, dry red chillies and cook lightly.
4. Now add the boiled rajma with some salt and mix.
5. From the top, throw in grated coconut and mix again.

title: Veg Jaipuri Recipe
method: 1. To begin with, heat ghee in a pan and add whole coriander seeds along with cashew nuts to give curry a unique and subtle flavour.
2. Then add, slit green chillies and sauté everything for 4-5 minutes. Once done, grind them into a fine powdery paste.
3. For jaipuri gravy, take chopped green beans, carrot and peas. Half boil them on medium flame.
4. After that, heat ghee in the pan again and add finely chopped onions, ginger and garlic. Keep sauteeing the onion until they get brown in colour.
5. Now, add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Now add Garam masala powder. Mix everything well.
6. Once done, add powdery mixture along with boiled vegetables, chopped capsicum and tomato puree.
7. Add salt according to your taste. After that add paneer cubes along with fresh cream and mix everything well.
8. The last step is to garnish it with some freshly chopped coriander leaves (cilantro) and serve hot paratha, roti or garlic naan.

title: Soya 65 Recipe
method: 1. Boil some soya chunks and then squeeze out excess water. Now fry them by corn flour.
2. Now, in a separate pan add some oil, throw in the fried soya chunks.
3. To this add red chilli powder, pepper, soy sauce, chilli sauce, little vinegar and salt as per taste and mix well. Make sure all the chunks are covered with the sauces.
4. Now add roughly chopped onions and capsicum. Stir again.
5. Garnish with green onions and serve.

title: Veg Patiala Recipe
method: 1. In a pan heat little oil and add chopped onions, beans, shredded cabbages, carrots, paneer, and mix for a while. To this add a little jeera powder, garam masala, salt, red chili powder and cook for 2-3 minutes with the lid on.
2. Once all the veggies are soft, you can take them off the heat.
3. Lay papad and spread little water on it, place the stuffing in the middle and roll the papad. Use water to press and seal the edges gently.
4. Once all the papad rolls are ready, shallow fry lightly and keep aside.
5. For the gravy, heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, saunf, ginger garlic paste, and crushed dry fruits. Let this cook until the raw smell is gone.
6. Now add onion paste and tomato paste and let it cook for some time.
7. Add the remaining dry spices and some water to get the right consistency.
8. Once the gravy is almost cooked, add cream, butter and mix well.
9. Place the stuffed papad roll gently in the gravy and finish off with grated paneer.

title: Rajma Patty Burger Recipe
method: 1. Take the boiled rajma, potatoes, peas and small bread pieces. Combine this with masalas and mix.
2. Give it the shape of Tikki and dip the Tikki in cornflour slurry and bread crumbs. Pan fry this till golden brown.
3. Then take the buns and lightly toast them with butter on a pan. Take it out and assemble your burger
4. Now first, add a layer of tomato ketchup on one side of the burger, then place the patty, cheese, sliced onion and tomato.
5. From the top, add sauces like mustard sauce, mayonnaise, or any other sauce of your choice.
6. Finally, close the bun, serve it with fries and enjoy!

title: Instant Coconut Barfi Recipe
method: 1. Boil sugar in water and form syrup.
2. Add desiccated coconut to it and mix thoroughly.
3. Add ghee and khoya and mix. Keep stirring continuously to avoid lump.
4. Add cardamom and give it a final mix.
5. Transfer the mix to a plate that is already greased with some ghee.
6. Even it out and let it rest for a while. Apply some ghee on the the top.
7. Now cut into barfi shapes and serve.

title: Potato Curry Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in a pan or kadai. Add finely chopped garlic and sauté .
2. Next add chopped onions. sauté till they turn translucent.
3. Then add chopped tomatoes and mix very well. Cover the pan with its lid and simmer on a low flame till the tomatoes soften and become mushy.
4. Then add turmeric powder, kashmiri red chilli powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder and cumin powder.
5. Add diced potatoes to the masala. Season with salt as required. Mix very well. Pour 2 cups water and mix again.
6. Cover the pan with its lid and let it cook. The curry will thicken slightly by the time the potatoes are done.
7. Once you get the desired consistency in the curry, then switch off the heat and add chopped coriander leaves. Mix very well.

title: Baby Corn Fingers Recipe
method: 1. Take a packet of baby corn and cut them from between.
2. Now in a separate bowl take some all-purpose flour, corn flour, oregano and salt to taste.
3. Add some water to this and form a slurry. Now, throw in baby corn and coat them well.
4. Next, fry till golden brown.
5. Once done add chaat masala, red chilli flakes and piri piri powder from top and serve hot.

title: Tricolor Finger Toastie Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl mix well all the vegetables, paneer and the Schezwan sauce.
1. Grate the cheese block and add all the ingredients and mix well.
1. Mash the boiled potatoes and add all the ingredients and mix well.
1. On a brown bread slice spread the paneer Schezwan mixture on the 1/3rd of the surface.
2. Continue by spreading the cheese chilli mixture on the next 1/3rd of the surface.
3. The last 1/3rd part would be finished by spreading the chatpata pudina aloo mixture.
4. Apply some butter on pan cover with a lid and cook on medium flame until the bread is crispy and the cheese has melted.
5. You can also bake it at 220°C for 7-8 minutes.
6. Cut length wise into 4 fingers. Your tricolour finger toasties is ready to be served, serve hot.

title: Schezwan Style Chilli Potatoes Recipe
method: 1. First peel and cut your potatoes in a long shape. Then add cornflour to it and fry them till cripsy.
2. In a separate pan then add, some oil, soy sauce, chill sauce, vinegar and mix these well.
3. Then add the chopped vegetables and make a slurry from cornflour. Mix this and then throw in your potatoes.
4. Now add some Schezwan sauce from the top and combine again.
5. Let it cook on low flame for a while. Then serve in a bowl and garnish with spring onions.

title: Potato Skin Chips Recipe
method: 1. Collect and clean the potato skin, then drizzle them with some olive oil and bake in the oven till they turn crispy and golden brown.
2. In a bowl, add salt, redchilli powder, pepper, oregano, peri-peri seasoning and combine to make the spice mix.
3. Once done, toss your baked potato skins in it.

title: Floating Island-Kattala Soup Recipe
method: 1. Peel both the potatoes, cut into 2-3 inch dices, heat the coconut oil and sauté Curry leaves, chopped onion, celery and Pandan leaves, add the potatoes in it and sauté well.
2. Add the curry powder, mix it well and saute it for 2-3 minutes.
3. Now, add Coconut water and Vegetable stock and boil it for 15-20 minutes.
4. Once the potatoes get tender blend it to smooth texture, pass it through a strainer.
5. With adding few more stock in it give boil for 5 minutes, add Coconut Milk and seasoning.
1. During boiling the potatoes for soup, take out 50 grams of it when it is 80% done and make a puree of it.
2. Heat a pan and add butter, add potato puree, and season it.
3. Add coconut milk to make it smoother.
4. With the help of piping bag, pipe it on a soup bowl like Island shapes.
5. Pour the hot Kattala Soup near the tiny Island of Curried Potatoes, serve hot.

title: Vegan Tofu Cigar Recipe
method: 1. Fill a large bowl with warm water. The bowl does not need to be large enough to fit the whole rice paper in one go.
2. Submerge the rice papers into the water for 3-5 seconds.
3. Take it out from the water and start placing tofu, Cucumber, Scallions, Carrot, Fresh Coriander Stalks, Celery Juliennes, Fresh Lettuce leave, Beans Sprout and Fresh Mint leaves.
4. Fold the left and right edges of the rice paper in, then starting from the bottom, then keep rolling firmly.
5. Serve immediately with the Hoisin Lime Dipping sauce.
1. Take a bowl, mix all the ingredients well, keep in a refrigerator for 30 minutes and serve with Vegan Tofu Cigar.

title: Kerala Style Potato Curry Recipe
method: 1. Add some jeera in hot oil, then add slit green chillies and onion. Let it cook for a while.
2. To this, add potatoes, salt, turmeric, red chilli powder, coriander powder, curry leaves and mix. Let this cook on medium to low flame for five minutes.
3. Now, add hot water, then tamarind water and garam masala, stir this well.
4. Throw in some coconut milk and cover the pan for about 10 minutes. Cook on low flame.

title: Lasaniya Battate Recipe
method: 1. Soak dried red chilli for 10 mins. After that, make a smooth paste of soaked chillies, garlic, ginger and tomato. Keep it aside; this is the base of the gravy.
2. Take 80% cooked baby potatoes and poke tiny holes with fork or skewers.
3. Now in a pan add oil and fry potatoes until golden brown from all sides. Remove them once done.
4. In the same pan, add bay leaf, chopped onions and cook for 2 minutes.
5. Now add chilli and garlic paste and the dried masalas like dhaniya powder, jeera powder, hing, chaat masala, haldi, red chilli powder and mix well.
6. Let the masala cook till it leaves oil on the sides.
7. Now add salt and the baby potatoes and stir everything well together. You can add water for a consistency of your liking or have it as it is.
8. Your Lasaniya battate is ready, garnish with a handful of coriander and enjoy with rice, roti or as a snack.

title: Lauki Vadi Recipe
method: 1. Take the grated lauki and add a little salt and lit is sit for 10 mins.
2. After 10 mins, squeeze all the water out of the lauki.
3. In a bowl, add lauki, besan, sooji, all the other ingredients and mix properly.
4. Be careful while adding salt because the lauki has already soaked in some salt before.
5. Mix everything properly; try using less water so your batter is mixed well but not liquidy.
6. Prepare round discs vadi to fry.
7. In a pan take 2tbspn oil, in low heat fry both sides for 5 minutes each. Once golden brown, you can remove and serve.

title: Aloo Paneer Bread Pakoda Recipe
method: 1. Take some besan and add salt to taste, a pinch of baking soda, pour in some water and keep the batter a little thick.
2. For the filling of this bread pakoda- mash your boiled potatoes and add salt, ginger garlic paste, red chilli powder, pepper and mix it well.
3. Then cut a thick slice of paneer and wrap the aloo mix around it.
4. Put this in the middle of two breads and cut in half.
5. Dip the bread in the besan batter and fry on medium to high flame till golden brown.

title: Gatte ke khichdi Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl add besan, red chilli powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala and salt to taste.
2. Mix well and form a dough.
3. When the dough is form, roll it out and boil them for 20 minutes.
4. Once done, form small gatte pieces and fry them.
5. Then in a pan fry throw in your hard spices and fry them with onion on low flame till soft.
6. Serve and enjoy!

title: Tadka Khichdi Recipe

ingredient.description: To garnish freshly chopped coriander leaves

method: 1. Boil dal and chawal with haldi and salt. Keep aside.
2. Heat oil in a kadhai, and add onion, ginger-garlic paste, green chillies, tomatoes, salt, sugar, jeera powder, haldi powder, dhania powder, garam masala powder, and red chilli powder.
3. Cook until the tomatoes turn soft and mushy.
4. Now, transfer the dal and chawal to this tomato-onion mix and cook until you get a semo-dry consistency.
5. Finally, heat ghee in a pan, add hing, jeera, whole red chilli and Kashmiri red chilli powder and wait till the jeera splutter.
6. Once the tadka is ready, pour it over the khichdi.
7. Garnish with some freshly chopped coriander leaves and a spoonful of ghee and serve.

title: Schezwan paneer Recipe
method: 1. Soak Dried red chillies in water for 10 mins then grind coarsely.
2. In a bowl, add cornflour, some salt, 1tspn black pepper, water and prepare a slurry to marinate paneer for atleast 10 mins.
3. After 10 mins shallow fry the paneer and keep it aside. Don’t throw the marinade, we will need this for the gravy.
4. In a pan heat some oil, add chopped ginger garlic and sautee for a while.
5. Add spring onions, Chilly paste and schezwan peppercorns and let it cook for some time.
6. To the chilli paste, add vinegar and soy sauce according to your liking. Then cook until the masala leaves some oil on the sides.
7. Add diced onions and Capsicum and stir.
8. Get the remaining marinade, add water to it and add this to the pan. Let is cook and thicken to your desired consistency.
9. Just 2 mins before it reaches your desired consistency, toss in the paneer and adjust salt and pepper according to your liking.
10. Let it simmer for a while and your Schezwan paneer is ready.

title: Seyal Bhaji Recipe
method: 1. Boil the potatoes and cauliflower, slit a few lady fingers and chop the potatoes and onions.
2. Coat these vegetables with turmeric powder, red chilli powder, pepper and salt. You can also choose to fry them if you want your vegetables to be crispy.
3. Then in a pan, add some oil and cook chopped onions and garlic till they turn soft then add tomatoes. Cook for two minutes.
4. Put in the green chillies, cauliflower, peas, lady fingers potatoes, turmeric powder, salt, red chilli, pepper and garam masala. Stir it till all the flavours combine.
5. Let it cook on low flame for at least six-eight minutes. Then slightly pour in some water and cook till all vegetables turn soft.

title: Oats and Vegetable Dhokla Recipe

ingredient.description: cup Mixed boiled vegetables (green peas, french beans, carrots)
To garnish chopped coriander and chilli powder

method: 1. In a bowl mix all the ingredients together.
2. Add the Eno fruit salt, mix thoroughly and let the batter froth.
3. Grease a thali with oil.
4. Pour the batter in the thali. Shake the thali till the mixture is evenly spread.
5. Sprinkle the coriander leaves and chilli powder on top.
6. Steam in a steamer for 8 to 9 minutes till the dhoklas are evenly cooked.
1. Cool the cooked dhoklas slightly and cut into pieces.
2. Serve with green coriander chutney.

title: Paneer Do Pyaza Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds, cardamom, green chillies and let it splutter.
2. Now add, ginger garlic paste and onion paste. Cook until onion paste gets little brownish in colour.
3. Add tomato puree and cook for 3-5 minutes. Then add salt, coriander powder, red chilli powder, garam masala powder and saute for a minute.
4. Add water and cook for 5-6 minutes.
5. Add cubed onions and paneer into the gravy, cover the lid and cook for 5 mins again.
6. Now add kasoori methi and mix well.
7. Garnish it with coriander leaves and serve hot with chapatis!

title: Veg Tangdi Kebab Recipe
method: 1. Take a large container and add, mashed potatoes, paneer, coriander leaves along with all the spices mentioned in the ingredients list.
2. Add lemon juice and mix everything well.
3. Roll bread slices from upside to down by using a roller.
4. Slightly apply water by using a brush on the inner surface of breads.
5. Fill it up with the prepared mixture and make a cylinderical shaped roll. Make sure to join it properly from all the sides.
6. Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the kebabs until golden brown.
7. Serve it with mint chutney or tomato sauce and savour!

title: Rugda Curry Recipe
method: 1. Cut rugda in half and clean it properly, then slightly sautee in a pan in a tbsp of oil.
2. Remove rugda and in the same pan heat the remaining oil. Add jeera, sliced onion and cook till onions are translucent.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook till the raw smell of ginger-garlic is gone.
4. Now add haldi, red chilli powder, dhaniya powder and some water so all the masala sticks together.
5. Add tomatoes and salt and cook till tomatoes are mushy.
6. Add the rugda and mix everything together.
7. Add 1 cup water and let it cook for another 5 mins or until you have your desired consistency.
8. Last step is to add garam masala, chopped coriander and chopped chillies for garnishing.
9. Stir and cover this for 2 mins and your rugda curry is ready.

title: 5 Minutes Pizza Sauce Recipe
method: 1. Blanche the tomatoes.
2. Deskin and de-seed them.
3. Chop them into small pieces and drain the excess water.
4. Chop the garlic cloves.
5. Now, put everything in a blender (except oil) and blend until a smooth paste.
6. Transfer it to a bowl, add the olive oil and mix.

title: Pasta samosa Recipe
method: 1. First take a bowl, add maida, a pinch of salt, some oil and knead dough. The dough shouldn’t be too soft or too hard. Cover this dough and let it rest for 20-30 minutes.
1. In a pan, bring water to a rolling boil then add pasta, a little salt and let it cook until it is 70% done or according to the instructions on your packet.
2. In another pan, add some oil, chopped garlic and sautee for 2 minutes.
3. Add all the chopped vegetables and cook that for some time as well.
4. Now add in your tomato puree and cook for another 2-4 min or until the raw taste of tomato is gone.
5. Finally add the boiled pasta, salt, the Italian seasoning, and some cheese on top and mix everything.
6. Making pasta samosa
7. Get the dough and take ball sized portions out of it.
8. Roll them into thin roti and cut in the middle.
9. Fold in a triangle shape, fill the pasta and seal edges with water to prevent spillage while frying.
10. In a kadhai, heat some oil and fry samosa till golden brown.
11. Serve with some cheesy dip or mint chutney, that’s your call.

title: Panki Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl add rice flour, curd and some water to form a smooth paste.
2. Then add all the other ingredients in this bowl.
3. Open up a banana leaf from one side and grease it properly.
4. Add your batter into it and bake it on a pan on medium to low heat.
5. Once golden brown, plate your panki and enjoy!

title: Kathal ke kebab Recipe
method: 1. Soak chana dal for 3-4 hours and cut down the jackfruit into small chunks.
2. After soaking and cutting, boil dal and jackfruit together until more than 80% cooked.
3. Now blend them together along with ginger garlic paste and green chillies in a blender.
4. Add all the seasonings and spices mentioned in the ingredients list with chopped coriander leaves. Mix well by using your hands.
5. Make small and rounded kebabs and shallow fry them on a pan with heated oil.
6. Serve with yogurt, mint chutney and onion rings.

title: Gujrati Tikha Pudla Recipe
method: 1. Take a bowl, add flour, spices, veggies along with mustard oil. Mix well and add water to form a consistent paste.
2. Now, heat a non-stick pan, smear few drops of oil and pour the mixture onto it. Spread it in a form of circle.
3. Drizzle some oil around the circle and wait until one side of the pudla turns golden brown.
4. Now flip by using spatula and let the pudla cook from other side as well.
5. Serve it with yogurt and enjoy!

title: Sooji toast Recipe
method: 1. Add sooji, curd, water to a bowl. Whisk well.
2. Add all the veggies, chilli, garlic and salt to the batter.
3. Let it rest for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, cut the bread slices diagonally into two pieces.
4. Heat butter in a pan and place the slices on the pan.
5. Once the bread is slightly toasted, flip it. Smear the batter on the top side of the bread and wait till the other side of the bread is toasted.
6. Flip the bread again and place the batter on it. Cook the bread on both the sides till it turns golden brown and crispy.
7. Serve it with green chutney or sauce.

title: Kumaoni Raita Recipe
method: 1. Take mustard seeds, garlic and green chilli in a mortar and pestle and pound into a smooth paste.
2. Whisk the dahi until smooth and creamy.
3. Add all the ingredients in the dahi and mix.
4. Garnish with some coriander leaves and serve.

title: Cheesy Potato and Quinoa Cake Recipe
method: 1. Boil peeled potatoes and grate them. Now, wash and boil quinoa as well. and then wash and chop green chillies, ginger and coriander.
2. In a bowl, take boiled grated potato, quinoa, chopped ginger, green chillies, coriander and all the above ingredients apart from oil.
3. Now add bread crumb and mix it well.
4. Make a round ball and stuff the smoked cheese in middle and keep inside the fridge for about 20 minutes.
5. Heat oil in a pan deep fry them.
6. Serve hot with mint or tamarind chutney and quinoa salad with fruits.

title: Agra Paratha Thali Recipe
method: 1. For the dough knead one cup of wheat and all-purpose together and let it rest for half an hour.
2. For stuffing take two potatoes, half cup of peas, chopped onions and shredded cauliflower.
3. Mix half tablespoon of pepper, chilli powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, chopped ginger, green chillies and salt according to taste.
4. Roll out your dough and fill the stuffing inside.
5. Shallow fry your parathas on the tawa till golden brown.
6. Now serve it with aloo ki sabzi, green chutney and kele ki chutney and enjoy!

title: Asparagus & Gari Tempura Roll Recipe
method: 1. Wash and rinse the sushi rice in running water to extract the excess starch from the rice grains. (process to be repeated 5 times).
2. Boil the sushi rice with water with the ratio of 1:1 ¼.
3. Make the sushi vinegar by mixing vinegar, sugar and salt.
4. Once the rice is cooked, mix the rice and the sushi vinegar together and keep it covered with a moist cloth until used further
1. Tempura fry the gari (pickled ginger) till crispy texture.
2. Place the nori sheet on the sushi mat and uniformly spread a handful of sushi rice on the sheet.
3. Flip the nori sheet in such a manner that the sushi rice is facing the sushi mat.
4. Spread the cream cheese in a line on the nori sheet and place the cut asparagus and gari tempura.
5. Gently roll the sushi into a square shape applying even pressure throughout the roll and cut into 8 equal pieces with a sharp knife.
6. Serve it with gari, wasabi and soy.

title: Avocado And Mango Uramaki Recipe
method: 1. Wash and rinse the sushi rice in running water to extract the excess starch from the rice grains. (process to be repeated 5 times).
2. Boil the sushi rice with water with the ratio of 1:1 ¼.
3. Make the sushi vinegar by mixing vinegar, sugar and salt.
4. Once the rice is cooked, mix the rice and the sushi vinegar together and keep it covered with a moist cloth until used further.
1. Place the nori sheet on the sushi mat and uniformly spread a handful of sushi rice on the sheet.
2. Sprinkle a mix of white and black sesame seeds on the sushi rice.
3. Flip the nori sheet in such a manner that the sushi rice is facing the sushi mat
4. Place the cut alphonso mango and avocado on the nori sheet.
5. Gently roll the sushi into a square shape applying even pressure throughout the roll and cut into 8 equal pieces with a sharp knife.
6. Serve it with gari, wasabi and soy.

title: Chhanar Bora (Bengali-Style Chenna Fritters) Recipe
method: 1. Boil the milk once and switch off the flame.
2. Add vinegar and stir the milk to curdle.
3. Strain the water and transfer the chhena in a mixing bowl.
4. Add maida, salt, sugar and red chilli to it and mix into a soft and moist dough.
5. Cut small roundels from the dough and give it an oval, almost-flat shape.
6. Heat refined oil in a pan and deep fry until the fritters turn golden brown in colour.

title: Millet Empanadas Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl add 1 cup jowar flour, 1tbsp oil and pinch salt. Mix this with 1 cup hot boiling water.
2. Once slightly cooled, knead into a medium dough and let it rest for 15-20 mins covered with a cloth.
1. Heat olive oil in a pan, saute chopped garlic along with chopped tomatoes. Cook till the tomatoes are soft and well cooked
2. Add salt, pepper and oregano as per taste along with red paprika and later add boiled corn, cheese spread along with ketchup and give it a good mix.
3. Now shape the dough into equal sized balls and roll it out thinly using a parchment paper.
4. Using a round cutter, cut the shape and add the filling in the center.
5. Apply water on the edges and turn over from one end to create a semicircular pocket.
6. To seal the edges take a folk and create impressions thereby giving it a pattern as well.
7. Shallow fry these or Air Fry them for 20 mins at 160 degree Celsius and serve hot.

title: Asian Peanut Butter Noodles Recipe
method: 1. Heat 3 tbsp sesame oil and add 5 cloves of chopped garlic, saute the garlic.
2. Turn off the heat, add soya sauce, chilli sauce and peanut butter.
3. Now, add honey, chilli flakes and black pepper. Mix well.
4. Add boiled, regular or gluten free noodles and mix until well incorporated.
5. Garnish with chopped herbs and also add sautéed vegetables. Serve and enjoy!

title: Aloo ki Jalebi Recipe
method: 1. Make sugar syrup by boiling sugar, cardamom powder, saffron powder in water for 5-7 minutes.
2. In a container, add flour, curd, boiled and mashed potatoes, salt and make a thick consistent batter.
3. Pour the solution in a cloth and make a hole in the cloth. Start by making spiral shaped jalebis in hot oil. Deep fry till golden brown.
4. Soak the jalebi into the sugar syrup for 2-3 minutes. Take it our and enjoy!

title: Indian Baked Samosa Pie Recipe
method: 1. Knead the dough with the mentioned ingredients and let it rest for 20 minutes.
2. In a pan, add potatoes, onions, peas and let it cook for 5 minutes on medium flame.
3. Then add cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, chilli powder and pepper.
4. Mix it well. And then cool it down for 15 minutes.
5. Roll out the dough in a bowl and add the potato filling.
6. Cover the filling with another sheet of the dough.
7. Spread butter from the top.
8. Preheat the oven at 300 degrees, then add your samosa pie.
9. Cook till the crust turns light brown.
10. Serve hot and crispy with classic mint sauce.

title: Kashmiri Nadru Monje Recipe

ingredient.description: to taste Kashmiri red chili powder

method: 1. Wash the lotus stems thoroughly and drain excessive water.
2. Cut into thin strips.
3. Toss them in a bowl of rice flour.
4. Add salt, cumin seeds and red chilli powder. Mix well.
5. Let the flour absorb water from lotus stems. Add some more water if required.
6. Deep fry the coated lotus stems in hot oil.

title: Mughlai Aloo Recipe
method: 1. Peel baby potatoes and wash them properly. Then soak them into cold water.
2. After 10 minutes, drain the potatoes and pierce them all over with the help of a fork. Add curd in the potatoes and salt. Set side for sometime
3. Heat ghee in a pan and fry the onions until transculent.
4. Add the ground paste and fry for a minute.
5. Add all spices including cumin powder, coriander powder, chilli powder, salt and stir for two minutes.
6. Add potato mixture and water according to the consistency you want.
7. Add cream and garnish with coriander leaves and roasted cashews and enjoy!

title: Butter Garlic Mushrooms Recipe
method: 1. Wash the mushrooms under running water and boil them in water till they are soft.
2. Take a pan and add butter and garlic. Let the flavour of garlic get infused in butter.
3. Then add the mushrooms and throw in salt, pepper and oregano.
4. Cook it on a medium flame for 10 minutes.

title: Rabodi Ki Sabzi Recipe
method: 1. Take the rabodi and soak it until they are soft.
2. In a pan, heat some oil and add cumin seeds, coriander powder, onion, green chillies, and cook it until the onions turn soft.
3. Next add curd and cook it until the oil starts floating on top.
4. Then put in the rabodi and mix till ingredients combine.
5. Cook on medium flame for 7-8 minutes.
6. Pour the sabzi in a bowl and garnish with coriander leaves.

title: Sindhi Tidli Dal Recipe
method: 1. Take the chaana dal, moong chilka dal and urad dal and soak it in a bowl of water for two hours.
2. After two hours, pour the dal in a cooker and add salt according to taste, turmeric powder, tomatoes, green chilli and ginger.
3. Let this cook for three-four whistles.
4. Then pour the dal into a bowl.
5. Prepare the tadka by heating the oil and add cumin seeds, heeng, chopped garlic, chilli according to taste.
6. Pour the hot tadka on top of the tidli dal.
7. Garnish with coriander leaves.

title: Dahi Kanji Recipe
method: 1. Take a vessel and add rice water/plain water, turmeric and salt. Add all the veggies and bring it to boil.
2. In a separate container, add curd, gram flour, turmeric and water. Mix well.
3. Add crushed pepper powder. Now add this curd mixture into the boiled vegetable pan. Add chopped ginger and hing water.
4. For tadka, add curry leaves, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds and cumin seeds in hot oil.
5. Add this tadka to the vegetable and curd mixture. Stir for 5-10 minutes.
6. Serve hot with chapatis or steamed rice.

title: Sanna Pakora Recipe
method: 1. Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl and mix well. (except oil for frying)
2. Make a thick and consistent batter by adjusting the water quantity.
3. Heat oil in the pan and add small portions of the batter into the hot oil and adjust the flame to low medium.
4. Fry the pakora until golden brown.
5. sprinkle some chaat masala and garnish with coriander leaves
6. Serve hot with your favourite chutney

title: Dalitoye Recipe
method: 1. Pressure cook toor dal, green chillies, salt and add oil.
2. Switch off the flame after two whistes or until dal is soft.
3. Blend the dal in the blender or use your hands to mash it.
4. Heat coconut oil in separate pan and add mustard seeds, hind, red chilli, and curry leaves. Now, pour the dal mixture into the pan
5. Serve it hot with steamed rice.

title: Papad ka Paratha Recipe
method: 1. Make soft wheat dough and keep it aside.
2. Meanwhile, crush the papad and sev/bhujia in a container
3. Add all the spices, coriander leaves and spring onions in the papad mixture and mix well.
4. Stuff the dough with the mixture and roll the paratha.
5. Roast it on tawa or deep fry them in a kadhai.
6. Serve hot with aloo ki sabzi or any chutney of your choice.

title: Boondi Ki Sabzi Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in pan, add hing and wait till it splutters.
2. Add onion and let it brown, saute ginger and garlic.
3. Add tomatoes, salt, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and coriander powder, and cook.
4. Add boondi, sprinkle some water. Cover the pan and let it all cook together for 2 minutes.
5. Add garam masala powder, coriander leaves and sev (optional). Serve.

title: Uggani Recipe
method: 1. Wash the puff rice in cold water and squeeze out the excess water.
2. In a pan add oil, curry leaves, mustard seeds, urad dal and peanuts. Cook it until they are soft brown.
3. Throw in the salt, turmeric and chilli powder as per your taste.
4. Then add your chopped onion and tomato. Cook for 5 minutes on low heat.
5. When the onions and tomatoes are soft, add your puffed rice.
6. Give them a good mix and put your uggani in a bowl
7. At last garnish it with coriander leaves and enjoy!

title: Turai Chilke Ki Sabzi Recipe
method: 1. Peel the skin of the vegetable and cut it into smaller pieces and wash the turai’s skin in cold water. .
2. Add two spoon of mustard oil and one spoon of cumin seeds and mustard seeds in a pan. Let them cook on high flame.
3. Then add your turai skin and cover the pan with a lid until the sabzi turn’s soft.
4. Add salt, turmeric powder, red chilli and one piece of green chilli according to your taste.
5. To this, add three table spoons of water and let the skin cook on a medium flame for 5 minutes.
6. Then add half chopped tomato and cook on low heat for another 5 minutes.
7. Now your sabzi is ready; serve it in a bowl and garnish with fresh coriander!

title: Rasgulla Chaat Recipe
method: 1. Squeeze out the Sugar syrup from the rasgulla and place them in a separate plate.
2. Now add potato mixture over the top of the rasgulla.
3. Drizzle hung curd, mint chutney, tamarind paste, jaljeera, black salt, chaat masala and other spices.
4. Garnish with coriander leaves, sev puri and pomegranate kernels.

title: Cucumber and spinach raita Recipe
method: 1. In the bowl of curd, add the chopped onions and cucumbers and give them a good mix.
2. Then add the blanched spinach paste until all the ingredients combine.
3. At last, throw in the ground cumin, salt and pepper according to your taste.
4. Serve it after its chilled.

title: Nepalese Piro Aloo Recipe
method: 1. Heat 2 tablespoons of mustard oil in a pan and then add fenugreek seed, red chillies. Let it splutter.
2. Add the potato, turmeric powder, salt and give it a good stir.
3. Cook the potatoes over high flame so that they get roasted and then simmer till the potatoes are cooked perfectly.
4. Place the potatoes aside and use the same pan to add a table spoon of mustard oil, ginger garlic paste and saute for 5 minutes.
5. Add the coriander, red chillies and nepali timur powder. Then place the potatoes into the pan and stir well for about 5 minutes.
6. Serve it hot with chapatis or any other breads of your choice.

title: Mango Phirni Recipe

ingredient.description: A pinch of Saffron (soaked in water)

method: 1. Wash and soak rice in water for around 1 hour.
2. Drain water and grind to make coarse paste.
3. In a pan, boil milk. Add rice paste and cook on low flame till milk thickens.
4. In a pan, boil milk. Add rice paste and cook on low flame till milk thickens.
5. Once the phirni comes down to room temperature, add mango pulp. Mix well.
6. Refrigerate before serving.

title: Almond And Sweet Potato Toast Recipe
method: 1. Roast the almonds with skin in preheated oven at 180 degree celsius for 4 minutes and cut into slivers once it cools down.
2. In a bowl, add dices of roasted sweet potato with salt, pepper, chaat masala, lemon juice, chopped ginger, chopped green chilli, green chutney and mayonnaise. Toss it well to mix evenly.
3. Toast the bread till golden colour.
4. Layer the mix of diced sweet potato over toasted bread and drizzle olive oil over it.
5. Sprinkle the almond slivers on it and serve.

title: Khatte Lehsuni Aloo Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in a pan. Saute garlic cloves till their raw smell goes away.
2. Add potatoes, green chilli, salt, and cover the pan to cook them.
3. When the potatoes are cooked, add red chilli powder and turmeric powder. Saute well.
4. Add mango power and lemon juice. Mix well, and serve.

title: Coriander Burnt Garlic Rice- Recipe
method: 1. Chop the carrots, beans, and corn.
2. Meanwhile, keep 1 bowl of boiled rice ready.
3. Take 2 pieces of eggs and fry them.
4. Chop some garlic and sauté with the pre-chopped veggies in refined oil
5. Sprinkle Salt and pepper on top.
6. Then add the fresh veggie broth, along with the rice.
7. Toss them on a pan.
8. Finally garnish with burnt garlic and coriander leaf.

title: Katsu Tofu Curry With Rice Recipe
method: 1. For Curry Sauce : Heat the oil in a saucepan and add the onion carrot, ginger and garlic until soft. Then add curry powder and turmeric. Once the spices are warmed through, add the coconut milk, maple syrup and water. Cover and simmer over a low heat for 20 minutes.
2. Cut the tofu into small cubes
3. In a bowl, add corn flour, water and seasoning. Mix it thoroughly.
4. Dip tofu pieces into the flour mixture and then add breadcrumbs and coat the tofu properly.
5. Heat the oil in a pan and deep fry tofu for 5-10 minutes until golden.
6. Add salt, maple syrup and lime juice.
7. To serve, pour the curry on a rice bowl with tofu, cucumber, herbs and lime wedges.

title: Oats Matar Cheela Recipe
method: 1. Overnight soak the rolled oats.
2. Boil the peas for a minute or two.
3. In a chutney grinder, add boiled peas, ginger, garlic, green chilli, ajwain, hing and salt. Grind everything into a paste.
4. Now drain the water and clean the oats well.
5. Coarsely mash the oats and add the peas paste to it. Mix everything together.
6. Now, heat a tawa and grease with some desi ghee on it.
7. Add a spoonful of peas to the tawa and spread it evenly.
8. On medium to low flame, cook each side well till it turns golden brown in colour. Add some ghee on the edges if needed.
9. Serve the cheelas hot with some ketchup by the side.

title: Manipuri Kelli Chana Recipe
method: 1. Heat some oil in a pan. Saute onions, green chillies, ginger and garlic.
2. Add tomatoes, cabbage, salt and rest of the spice powders. Cook till tomatoes soften.
3. Add boiled chickpeas and mix well.
4. Garnish with coriander leave and serve.

title: Mushroom Cappuccino Soup Recipe

ingredient.description: A pinch of white pepper powder

method: 1. Clean, wash and cut the mushrooms into thick slices. Melt butter in a heavy bottomed pan; add onion and garlic and sauté for two to three minutes or until onion turns brown. Add the mushrooms and sauté for a minute. t
2. Make a puree of the cooked mushrooms. t
3. Place a saucepan on the range and add the mushroom puree with milk and cream, add the seasoning and remove from heat. t
4. Pour the hot soup in a container jar, add butter and use hand blender to make a thick froth. t
5. Then pour the soup in serving cups. Top it up with the froth, sprinkle truffle oil with porcini mushroom dust and serve hot. t

title: Soybean And Baby Potatoes Biryani Recipe

ingredient.description: extra water for soaking soyabean and rice

method: 1. Soak soyabean in boiling water till they are completely softened.
2. Squeeze out the water from them and keep it aside.
3. Wash and rinse the rice thoroughly and soak it at room temperature water for 20 minutes.
4. Slice the baby potatoes into half or cut the regular potatoes into cubes. Do not remove the skin.
5. Thinly slice onions and roughly chop tomatoes.
1. In a large heavy bottom pot - Heat mustard oil till it starts to smoke and shallow fry potatoes till the skin gets crisp (High flame for 3-4 minutes).
2. Take them out and add Soyabean chunks on the same oil and fry for 1-2 minutes on high flame.
3. Strain the soyabean and set them aside with potatoes.
4. Lower the heat to medium - Add ghee to the same pot and add all whole spices - stir for 1 minute.
5. Add sliced onions and cook till they brown slightly. Add garlic cloves + ginger garlic paste and cook for 3 minutes.
6. Add all tomatoes + curry leaves + salt + all the powdered spices and stir.
7. Cover and cook till oil separates from the tomato-spice mixture (Took me around 10 minutes on low flame).
8. Drain the soaked rice and add to the sautéed masala - mix well. Add fried potatoes + soyabean and mix.
9. Add coconut milk and stir well. Add water, stir well and adjust salt or any other masala as per your choice at this point. Bring the biryani to a boil
10. Once it starts to boil - Cover with a heavy lid and cook for 10-15 minutes on lowest flame.
11. Check after 10 minutes to see if the rice is fully cooked and the water is all soaked.
12. Switch off the flame and let it rest for 10 mins before serving. Serve hot with your favourite raita and some ghee drizzled on top.
